Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

Amos

SummaryThe purpose of the book of Amos was to announce God’s holy judgment on the Kingdom of Israel (the Northern Kingdom), call them to repentance, and to turn from their self-righteous sins and idolatry. God raised up the prophet Amos, as an act of His great mercy to a people who repeatedly shunned and disobeyed Him.

•    Chapter 1-3, Amos came as the days of the wicked Northern Kingdom were winding down. The people were religious but it was sadly superficial. Amos announces that the neighboring nations would be punished. There were many of these wicked nations including Damascus, Gaza, Edom, and Tyre.

•    In chapters 4-8, Amos warns that Israel will be destroyed, and gives examples of this judgment. Amos comes, announces God’s coming judgment to the Northern Kingdom and uses the phrase, “the day of the Lord” referring to God intervening to punish and judge the wicked city, which would eventually be exile by the Assyrians.“Seek good and not evil, that you may live; and thus may the LORD God of hosts be with you, just as you have said!” (5:14).

•    In chapter 9, Amos tells of the restoration and hope of Israel, “In that day I will raise up the fallen booth of David, and wall up its breaches; I will also raise up its ruins And rebuild it as in the days of old” (9:11).
    Outline
  2. 1. Prophecy against All Nations  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2:16 )
  3. a. Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2:5 )
  4. i.   Introduction  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2 )
  5. ii.  Judgment on Aram  ( 1:3⁠–⁠5 )
  6. iii. Judgment on the Philistines  ( 1:6⁠–⁠8 )
  7. iv. Judgment on Tyre  ( 1:9⁠–⁠10 )
  8. v.  Judgment on Edom  ( 1:11⁠–⁠12 )
  9. vi. Judgment on the Ammonites  ( 1:13⁠–⁠15 )
  10. vii. Judgment on Moab  ( 2:1⁠–⁠3 )
  11. viii. Judgment on Judah  ( 2:4⁠–⁠5 )
  12. b. Judgment on Israel  ( 2:6⁠–⁠16 )
  13. 2. Prophecy against Israel  ( 3:1⁠–⁠6:14 )
  14. a. Witnesses against Israel  ( 3:1⁠–⁠15 )
  15. b. Punishment Brings No repentance  ( 4:1⁠–⁠13 )
  16. c. A Lamentation against Israel  ( 5:1⁠–⁠3 )
  17. d. A Call to Repentance  ( 5:4⁠–⁠15 )
  18. e. Woe to Rebellious Israel  ( 5:16⁠–⁠27 )
  19. f. Woe to Those at Ease in Zion  ( 6:1⁠–⁠7 )
  20. g. The Pride of Israel  ( 6:8⁠–⁠14 )
  21. 3. Visions of Judgment  ( 7:1⁠–⁠9:15 )
  22. a. The LORD Relented  ( 7:1⁠–⁠6 )
  23. i.   The Locust Swarm  ( 7:1⁠–⁠3 )
  24. ii.  Judgment by Fire  ( 7:4⁠–⁠6 )
  25. b. The LORD Does Not Relent  ( 7:7⁠–⁠9:10 )
  26. i.   The Plumb Line  ( 7:7⁠–⁠17 )
  27. 1. The Vision  ( 7:7⁠–⁠9 )
  28. 2. Amaziah Accuses Amos  ( 7:10⁠–⁠17 )
  29. ii.  The Basket of Summer Fruit  ( 8:1⁠–⁠14 )
  30. iii. The Destruction of Israel  ( 9:1⁠–⁠10 )
  31. c. A Promise of Restoration  ( 9:11⁠–⁠15 )

1
Prophecy against All Nations

Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors

דִּבְרֵ֣י עָמֹ֔וס אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה בַנֹּקְדִ֖ים מִתְּקֹ֑ועַ אֲשֶׁר֩ חָזָ֨ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בִּימֵ֣י ׀ עֻזִּיָּ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה וּבִימֵ֞י יָרָבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־יֹואָשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁנָתַ֖יִם לִפְנֵ֥י הָרָֽעַשׁ׃

1 The words of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.Amos 1:1
Stats
Rank: #3014 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 216 characters, 38 words, 170 letters, 67 vowels, 103 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י עָמֹ֔וס אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה בַנֹּקְדִ֖ים מִתְּקֹ֑ועַ אֲשֶׁר֩ חָזָ֨ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בִּימֵ֣י ׀ עֻזִּיָּ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה וּבִימֵ֞י יָרָבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־יֹואָשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁנָתַ֖יִם לִפְנֵ֥י הָרָֽעַשׁ׃

Lit: The words of Amos who was among the sheepherders of Tekoa which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam son of Joash king of Israel two years before the earthquake

KJV: The words of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
References

"The words"
Jer 1:1: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah: of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:
Jer 7:27: Therefore you will speak all these words to them; but they not will listen to you: you will also call to them; but they not will answer you.

"who"
Am 7:14: Then answered Amos: and said to Amaziah: I was no prophet: neither was I a prophet's son; but I was an herdman: and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:
Ex 3:1: Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro His father in law: the priest of Midian: and He led the flock to the backside of the desert: and came to the mountain of God: even to Horeb.
1Ki 19:19: So he departed there: and found Elisha the son of Shaphat: who was plowing with 12 yoke of oxen before him: and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed by him: and cast his mantle upon him.
Ps 78:70-72: He chose David also his servant: and took him from the sheepfolds:
Mt 4:18: Jesus: walking by the sea of Galilee: saw two brothers: Simon called Peter: and Andrew His brother: casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
1Co 1:27: But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God has chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

"Tekoa"
2Sa 14:2: Joab sent to Tekoah: and fetched there a wise woman: and said to her: I pray you: feign yourself to be a mourner: and put on now mourning apparel: and not anoint yourself with oil: but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:
2Ch 11:6: He built even Bethlehem: and Etam: and Tekoa:
2Ch 20:20: They rose early in the morning: and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth: Jehoshaphat stood and said: Hear me: O Judah: and you inhabitants of Jerusalem; Believe in the LORD your God: so will you be established; believe His prophets: so will you prosper.
Jer 6:1: O you children of Benjamin: gather yourselves to flee out of the middle of Jerusalem: and blow the trumpet in Tekoa: and set up a sign of fire in Bethhaccerem: for evil appears out of the north: and great destruction.

"he saw"
Isa 1:1: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz: which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah: Jotham: Ahaz: and Hezekiah: kings of Judah.
Mic 1:1: The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham: Ahaz: and Hezekiah: kings of Judah: which He saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.

"in the"
2Ki 14:21: All the people of Judah took Azariah: which was 16 years old: and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.
2Ki 15:1: 2: In the 20 and seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.

"Azariah"
2Ch 26:1-23: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah: who was 16 years old: and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
Ho 1:1: The word of the LORD that came to Hosea: the son of Beeri: in the days of Uzziah: Jotham: Ahaz: and Hezekiah: kings of Judah: and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash: king of Israel.
Mt 1:8: 9: Asa begot Josaphat; and Josaphat begot Joram; and Joram begot Ozias;

"and in"
Am 7:9-11: The high places of Isaac will be desolate: and the sanctuaries of Israel will be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.
2Ki 14:23-29: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria: and reigned 41 years.

"the earthquake"
Zec 14:5: you will flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley of the mountains will reach to Azal: yes: you will flee: like as you fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah: and the LORD my God will come: and all the saints with you.

H559וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀way-yō-mar   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms)

H3068יְהוָה֙Yah-weh   (N-proper-ms)
H3068 יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh yeh-ho-vaw from הָיָה; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jehovah, Jewish national name of God; Jehovah, the Lord. Compare יָהּ, יְהֹוִה. 		יְהוָה֙Yah-weh Yahweh N-proper-ms

H7462 רָעָה râʻâh raw-aw a primitive root; to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend); idiom break, companion, keep company with, devour, eat up, evil entreat, feed, use as a friend, make friendship with, herdman, keep (sheep) (-er), pastor, phrase shearing house, shepherd, wander, waste. 		הָרֹעִ֔יםhā-rō-‘îm, the shepherds Art | V-Qal-Prtcpl-mp

H3001 יָבֵשׁ yâbêsh yaw-bashe a primitive root; to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage); be ashamed, clean, be confounded, (make) dry (up), (do) shame(-fully), idiom utterly, wither (away)., 		וְיָבֵ֖שׁwə-yā-ḇêš and withers Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms
H7218רֹ֥אשׁrōš   (N-msc)
H7218 רֹאשׁ rôʼsh roshe from an unused root apparently meaning to shake; the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.); band, beginning, captain, chapiter, chief(-est place, man, things), company, end, idiom every (man), excellent, first, forefront, (be-)head, height, (on) high(-est part, (priest)), idiom lead, idiom poor, principal, ruler, sum, top. 		רֹ֥אשׁrōš Top N-msc
H3760הַכַּרְמֶֽל׃hak-kar-mel.   (Art | N-proper-fs)
H3760 כַּרְמֶל Karmel kar-mel the same as כַּרְמֶל; Karmel, the name of a hill and of a town in Palestine; Carmel, fruitful (plentiful) field, (place). 		הַכַּרְמֶֽל׃hak-kar-mel. of the Carmel Art | N-proper-fs
2 He said, The LORD will roar from Zion, and utter His voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds will mourn, and the top of Carmel will where.Amos 1:2
Stats
Rank: #2462 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 164 characters, 26 words, 130 letters, 47 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀ יְהוָה֙ מִצִּיֹּ֣ון יִשְׁאָ֔ג וּמִירוּשָׁלִַ֖ם יִתֵּ֣ן קֹולֹ֑ו וְאָֽבְלוּ֙ נְאֹ֣ות הָרֹעִ֔ים וְיָבֵ֖שׁ רֹ֥אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶֽל׃ פ

Lit: And he said Yahweh from Zion roars and from Jerusalem utters His voice and mourn the pastures of the shepherds and withers Top of the Carmel

KJV: And he said, The LORD will roar from Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds shall mourn, and the top of Carmel shall wither.
References

"The Lord"
Am 3:7: 8: Surely the Lord GOD will not dohing: but He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets.
Pr 20:2: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own soul.
Isa 42:13: The LORD will go forth as a mighty man: He will stir up jealousy like a man of war: He will cry: yes: roar; He will prevail against His enemies.
Jer 25:30: Therefore prophesy you against them all these words: and say to them: The LORD will roar from on high: and utter His voice from His holy habitation; He will mightily roar upon His habitation; He will give a shout: as they that tread the grapes: against all the inhabitants of the earth.
Ho 13:8: I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps: and will rend the caul of their heart: and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast will tear them.
Joe 2:11: The LORD will utter His voice before His army: for His camp is very great: for He is strong that executes His word: for the day of the LORD is great and very terrible; and who can abide it?
Joe 3:16: The LORD also will roar out of Zion: and utter His voice from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth will shake: but the LORD will be the hope of His people: and the strength of the children of Israel.

"the habitations"
Am 4:7: 8: Also I have withholden the rain from you: when there were yet 3 months to the harvest: and I caused it to rain upon one city: and caused not it to rain upon another city: one piece was rained upon: and the piece whereupon it not rained withered.
Isa 33:9: The earth mourns and languishes: Lebanon is ashamed and cut down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
Jer 12:4: How long will the land mourn: and the herbs of every field where: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed: and the birds; because they said: He will not see our last end.
Jer 14:2: Judah mourns: and the gates thereof languish; they are black to the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.
Joe 1:9-13: 16-18: The meat offering and the drink offering is cut off from the house of the LORD; the priests: the LORD's ministers: mourn.

"Carmel"
1Sa 25:2: there was a man in Maon: whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great: and he had 3000 sheep: and a000 goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
Isa 35:2: It will blossom abundantly: and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon will be given to it: the excellency of Carmel and Sharon: they will see the glory of the LORD: and the excellency of our God.
Jer 50:19: I will bring Israel again to his habitation: and he will feed on Carmel and Bashan: and his soul will be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.
Na 1:4: He rebukes the sea: and makes it dry: and dries up all the rivers: Bashan languishes'>languishes: and Carmel: and the flower of Lebanon languishes'>languishes.

Judgment on Aram

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י דַמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־דּוּשָׁ֛ם בַּחֲרֻצֹ֥ות הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל אֶת־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃

H3541כֹּ֚הkōh   (Adv)
H3541 כֹּה kôh ko from the prefix k and הוּא; properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now; also, here, + hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), + mean while, yonder., 		כֹּ֚הkōh Thus Adv

H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- for Prep

3 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Damascus, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:Amos 1:3
Stats
Rank: #9211 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 187 characters, 26 words, 153 letters, 54 vowels, 99 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י דַמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־דּוּשָׁ֛ם בַּחֲרֻצֹ֥ות הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל אֶת־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Damascus for four not I will turn away its punishment because they have threshed with implements of iron Gilead

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:
References

"For"
Am 1:6: 9: 11: 13: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Gaza: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they carried away captive the whole captivity: to deliver them up to Edom:
Am 2:1: 4: 6: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Moab: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because He burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:
Job 5:19: He will deliver you in 6 troubles: yes: in 7 there will no evil touch you.
Job 19:3: These 10 times have you reproached me: you not are ashamed that you make yourselves strange to me.
Pr 6:16: These 6 things does the LORD hate: yes: 7 are an abomination to Him:
Ec 11:2: Give a portion to 7: and also to 8; for you know not what evil will be upon the earth.

"Damascus"
Isa 7:8: For the head of Syria is Damascus: and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and 5 years will Ephraim be broken: that it not be a people.
Isa 8:4: For before the child will have knowledge to cry: My father: and my mother: the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be taken away before the king of Assyria.
Isa 17:1: The burden of Damascus. Look: Damascus is taken away from being a city: and it will be a ruinous heap.
Jer 49:23-27: Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded: and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
Zec 9:1: The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach: and Damascus will be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man: as of all the tribes of Israel: will be toward the LORD.

"turn away the punishment thereof"
Am 6:1-14: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion: and trust in the mountain of Samaria: which are named chief of the nations: to whom the house of Israel came!

"because"
1Ki 19:17: It will come to pass: that him that escapes'>escapes the sword of Hazael will Jehu kill: and him that escapes'>escapes from the sword of Jehu will Elisha kill.
2Ki 8:12: Hazael said: Why weeps my lord? And he answered: Because I know the evil that you will do to the children of Israel: their strong holds will you set on fire: and their young men will you kill with the sword: and will dash their children: and rip up their women with child.
2Ki 10:32: 33: In those days the LORD began to cut Israel short: and Hazael smote them in all the coasts of Israel;
2Ki 13:3: 7: The anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel: and He delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria: and into the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael: all their days.
Isa 41:15: Look: I will make you a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: you will thresh the mountains: and beat them small: and will make the hills as chaff.

4 But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, which will devour the palaces of Benhadad.Amos 1:4
Stats
Rank: #2900 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 92 characters, 17 words, 73 letters, 30 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּבֵ֣ית חֲזָאֵ֑ל וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹ֥ות בֶּן־הֲדָֽד׃

Lit: But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael and which shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad

KJV: But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, which shall devour the palaces of Benhadad.
References

"I will"
Am 1:7: 10: 12: 14: But I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza: which will devour the palaces thereof:
Am 2:2: 5: But I will send a fire upon Moab: and it will devour the palaces of Kerioth: and Moab will die with tumult: with shouting: and with the sound of the trumpet:
Jg 9:19: 20: 57: If you then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day: then rejoice you in Abimelech: and let him also rejoice in you:
Jer 17:27: But if you not will listen to me to hallow the sabbath day: not and to bear a burden: even entering in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof: and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem: and it will not be quenched.
Jer 49:27: I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus: and it will consume the palaces of Benhadad.
Eze 30:8: They will know that I am the LORD: when I have set a fire in Egypt: and when all her helpers will be destroyed.
Eze 39:6: I will send a fire on Magog: and among them that dwell carelessly in the isles: and they will know that I am the LORD.
Ho 8:14: For Israel has forgotten his Maker: and builds temples; and Judah has multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities: and it will devour the palaces thereof.

"Hazael"
1Ki 19:15: The LORD said to Him: Go: return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus: and when you come: anoint Hazael to be king over Syria:
2Ki 8:7-15: Elisha came to Damascus; and Benhadad the king of Syria was sick; and it was told Him: saying: The man of God is come here.

"Benhadad"
1Ki 20:1-22: Benhadad the king of Syria gathered all his host together: and there were 32 kings with him: and horses: and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria: and warred against it.
2Ki 6:24: It came to pass after this: that Benhadad king of Syria gathered all his host: and went up: and besieged Samaria.

5 I will break also the bar of Damascus, and cut off the inhabitant from the plain of Aven, and Him that holds the sceptre from the house of Eden: and the people of Syria will go into captivity to Kir, says the LORD.Amos 1:5
Stats
Counts: 220 characters, 39 words, 173 letters, 65 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשָֽׁבַרְתִּי֙ בְּרִ֣יחַ דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י יֹושֵׁב֙ מִבִּקְעַת־אָ֔וֶן וְתֹומֵ֥ךְ שֵׁ֖בֶט מִבֵּ֣ית עֶ֑דֶן וְגָל֧וּ עַם־אֲרָ֛ם קִ֖ירָה אָמַ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ פ

Lit: And I will break the gate bar of Damascus and cut off the inhabitant from the Valley of Aven and the one who holds and the scepter from from the house Beth Eden and shall go captive the people of Syria to Kir says Yahweh

KJV: I will break also the bar of Damascus, and cut off the inhabitant from the plain of Aven, and him that holdeth the sceptre from the house of Eden: and the people of Syria shall go into captivity unto Kir, saith the LORD.
References

"break"
Isa 43:14: Thus says the LORD: your redeemer: the Holy one of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon: and have brought down all their nobles: and the Chaldeans: whose cry is in the ships.
Jer 50:36: A sword is upon the liars; and they will dote: a sword is upon her mighty men; and they will be dismayed.
Jer 51:30: The mighty men of Babylon have forborn to fight: they have remained in their holds: their might has failed; they became as women: they have burned her dwellingplaces; her bars are broken.
La 2:9: Her gates are sunk into the ground; He has destroyed and broken her bars: her king and her princes are among the Gentiles: the law is no more; her prophets also find no vision from the LORD.
Na 3:13: Look: your people in the middle of you are women: the gates of your land will be set wide open to your enemies: the fire will devour your bars.

"the people"
Am 9:7: Are you not as children of the Ethiopians to me: O children of Israel? says the LORD. not Have I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor: and the Syrians from Kir?
2Ki 16:9: The king of Assyria listened to him: for the king of Assyria went up against Damascus: and took it: and carried the people of it captive to Kir: and killed Rezin.

Judgment on the Philistines

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י עַזָּ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־הַגְלֹותָ֛ם גָּל֥וּת שְׁלֵמָ֖ה לְהַסְגִּ֥יר לֶאֱדֹֽום׃

6 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Gaza, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they carried away captive the whole captivity, to deliver them up to Edom:Amos 1:6
Stats
Rank: #3523 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 198 characters, 27 words, 157 letters, 60 vowels, 97 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י עַזָּ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־הַגְלֹותָ֛ם גָּל֥וּת שְׁלֵמָ֖ה לְהַסְגִּ֥יר לֶאֱדֹֽום׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Gaza for four not I will turn away its punishment because they took captive the captivity whole to deliver them up to Edom

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they carried away captive the whole captivity, to deliver [them] up to Edom:

"three"

"Gaza"

Eze 25:15: 16: Thus says the Lord GOD; Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge: and have taken vengeance with a despiteful heart: to destroy it for the old hatred;

H3069יְהוִֽה׃Yah-weh.   (N-proper-ms)
H3069 יְהֹוִה Yᵉhôvih yeh-ho-vee a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God. 		יְהוִֽה׃Yah-weh. GOD N-proper-ms
8 I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, and Him that holds the sceptre from Ashkelon, and I will turn my hand against Ekron: and the remnant of the Philistines will perish, says the Lord GOD.Amos 1:8
Stats
Rank: #3962 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 204 characters, 33 words, 163 letters, 55 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י יֹושֵׁב֙ מֵֽאַשְׁדֹּ֔וד וְתֹומֵ֥ךְ שֵׁ֖בֶט מֵֽאַשְׁקְלֹ֑ון וַהֲשִׁיבֹ֨ותִי יָדִ֜י עַל־עֶקְרֹ֗ון וְאָֽבְדוּ֙ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יְהוִֽה׃ פ

Lit: And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod and the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon and I will turn My hand against Ekron and shall perish the remnant of the Philistines says the Lord GOD

KJV: And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, and him that holdeth the sceptre from Ashkelon, and I will turn mine hand against Ekron: and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish, saith the Lord GOD.
References

"I will cut"
Isa 20:1: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod: (when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him: ) and fought against Ashdod: and took it;
Jer 47:5: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is cut off with the remnant of their valley: how long will you cut yourself?
Eze 25:16: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will stretch out my hand upon the Philistines: and I will cut off the Cherethims: and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.

"turn"
Ps 81:14: I should soon have subdued their enemies: and turned my hand against their adversaries.
Isa 1:25: I will turn my hand upon you: and purely purge away your dross: and take away all your tin:
Zec 13:7: Awake: O sword: against my shepherd: and against the man that is my fellow: says the LORD of hosts: smite the shepherd: and the sheep will be scattered: and I will turn my hand upon the little ones.

"and the"
Isa 14:29-31: not Rejoice you: whole Palestina: because the rod of him that smote you is broken: for out of the serpent's root will come forth a cockatrice: and his fruit will be a fiery flying serpent.
Jer 47:4: 5: Because of the day that comes to spoil all the Philistines: and to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remains: for the LORD will spoil the Philistines: the remnant of the country of Caphtor.
Eze 25:16: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will stretch out my hand upon the Philistines: and I will cut off the Cherethims: and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.
Zep 2:4-7: For Gaza will be forsaken: and Ashkelon a desolation: they will drive out Ashdod at the noon day: and Ekron will be rooted up.

Judgment on Tyre

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵי־צֹ֔ר וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־הַסְגִּירָ֞ם גָּל֤וּת שְׁלֵמָה֙ לֶאֱדֹ֔ום וְלֹ֥א זָכְר֖וּ בְּרִ֥ית אַחִֽים׃

9 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Tyrus, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, and not remembered the brotherly covenant:Amos 1:9
Stats
Rank: #3829 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 212 characters, 30 words, 172 letters, 62 vowels, 110 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵי־צֹ֔ר וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־הַסְגִּירָ֞ם גָּל֤וּת שְׁלֵמָה֙ לֶאֱדֹ֔ום וְלֹ֥א זָכְר֖וּ בְּרִ֥ית אַחִֽים׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Tyre for four not I will turn away its punishment because they delivered up the captivity whole to Edom and not did remember the covenant of brotherhood

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Tyrus, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, and remembered not the brotherly covenant:
References

"Tyrus"
Isa 23:1-18: The burden of Tyre. Howl: you ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste: so that there is no house: no entering in: from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.
Jer 47:4: Because of the day that comes to spoil all the Philistines: and to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remains: for the LORD will spoil the Philistines: the remnant of the country of Caphtor.
Eze 26:1-28: It came to pass in the eleventh year: in the first day of the month: that the word of the LORD came to me: saying:
Joe 3:4-8: Yes: and what have you to do with me: O Tyre: and Zidon: and all the coasts of Palestine? will you render me a recompence? and if you recompense me: swiftly and speedily will I return your recompence upon your own head;
Zec 9:2-4: Hamath also will border thereby; Tyrus: and Zidon: though it be very wise.

"because"
Am 1:6: 11: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Gaza: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they carried away captive the whole captivity: to deliver them up to Edom:

"brotherly covenant"
2Sa 5:11: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David: and cedar trees: and carpenters: and masons: and they built David an house.
1Ki 5:1-11: Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
1Ki 9:11-14: (Now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees: and with gold: according to all his desire: ) that then king Solomon gave Hiram 20 cities in the land of Galilee.
2Ch 2:8-16: Send me also cedar trees: fir trees: and algum trees: out of Lebanon: for I know that your servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and: look: my servants will be with your servants:

Judgment on Edom

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י אֱדֹ֔ום וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־רָדְפֹ֨ו בַחֶ֤רֶב אָחִיו֙ וְשִׁחֵ֣ת רַחֲמָ֔יו וַיִּטְרֹ֤ף לָעַד֙ אַפֹּ֔ו וְעֶבְרָתֹ֖ו שְׁמָ֥רָה נֶֽצַח׃

H3069יְהוָ֔הYah-weh,   (N-proper-ms)
H3069 יְהֹוִה Yᵉhôvih yeh-ho-vee a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God. 		יְהוָ֔הYah-weh, Yahweh N-proper-ms
H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)

H5331נֶֽצַח׃ne-ṣaḥ.   (N-ms)
H5331 נֶצַח netsach neh-tsakh or נֵצַח; from נָצַח; properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view); alway(-s), constantly, end, (phrase n-) ever(more), perpetual, strength, victory. 		נֶֽצַח׃ne-ṣaḥ. forever N-ms
11 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Edom, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because He did pursue His brother with the sword, and did cast off all pity, and His anger did tear perpetually, and He kept His wrath for ever:Amos 1:11
Stats
Rank: #4052 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 258 characters, 41 words, 203 letters, 72 vowels, 131 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י אֱדֹ֔ום וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־רָדְפֹ֨ו בַחֶ֤רֶב אָחִיו֙ וְשִׁחֵ֣ת רַחֲמָ֔יו וַיִּטְרֹ֤ף לָעַד֙ אַפֹּ֔ו וְעֶבְרָתֹ֖ו שְׁמָ֥רָה נֶֽצַח׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Edom for four not I will turn away its punishment because he pursued with the sword his brother and cast off all pity and tore perpetually His anger and his wrath he kept forever

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he did pursue his brother with the sword, and did cast off all pity, and his anger did tear perpetually, and he kept his wrath for ever:

"Edom"
Isa 21:11: 12: The burden of Dumah. He calls to me out of Seir: Watchman: what of the night? Watchman: what of the night?
Isa 34:1-17: Come near: you nations: to hear; and listen: you people: let the earth hear: and all that is therein; the world: and all things that come forth of it.
Isa 63:1-7: Who is this that comes from Edom: with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel: travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness: mighty to save.
Jer 49:7-22: Concerning Edom: thus says the LORD of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?
Eze 25:12-14: Thus says the Lord GOD; Because that Edom has dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance: and has greatly offended: and revenged Himself upon them;
Eze 35:1-15: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me: saying:
Ob 1:1-14: The vision of Obadiah. Thus says the Lord GOD concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from the LORD: and an ambassador is sent among the heathen: Arise you: and let us rise up against her in battle.
Mal 1:4: Whereas Edom says: We are impoverished: but we will return and build the desolate places; thus says the LORD of hosts: They will build: but I will throw down; and they will call them: The border of wickedness: and: The people against whom the LORD has indignation for ever.

"because"
Ge 27:40: 41: By your sword will you live: and will serve your brother; and it will come to pass when you will have the dominion: that you will break his yoke from off your neck.
Nu 20:14-21: Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom: Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the travail that has befallen us:
De 2:4-8: Command you the people: saying: You are to pass through the coast of your brothers the children of Esau: which dwell in Seir; and they will be afraid of you: take you good heed to yourselves therefore:
De 23:7: You will not abhor an Edomite; for he is your brother: you will not abhor an Egyptian; because you were a stranger in his land.
2Ch 28:17: For again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah: and carried away captives.
Ps 83:3-8: They have taken crafty counsel against your people: and consulted against your hidden ones.
Ps 137:7: Remember: O LORD: the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said: Rase it: rase it: even to the foundation thereof.
La 4:21: 22: Rejoice and be glad: O daughter of Edom: that dwell in the land of Uz; the cup also will pass through to you: you will be drunken: and will make yourself naked.
Eze 25:12: Thus says the Lord GOD; Because that Edom has dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance: and has greatly offended: and revenged Himself upon them;
Eze 35:5: 6: 11: Because you have had a perpetual hatred: and have shed the blood of the children of Israel by the force of the sword in the time of their calamity: in the time that their iniquity had an end:
Joe 3:19: Egypt will be a desolation: and Edom will be a desolate wilderness: for the violence against the children of Judah: because they have shed innocent blood in their land.
Ob 1:10-14: For your violence against your brother Jacob shame will cover you: and you will be cut off for ever.
Mal 1:2: I have loved you: says the LORD. Yet you say: Wherein have you loved us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother? says the LORD: yet I loved Jacob:

"kept"
Ps 85:5: Will you be angry with us for ever? will you draw out your anger to all generations?
Ec 7:9: not Be hasty in your spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
Isa 57:16: For I not will contend for ever: neither will I be always angry: for the spirit should fail before me: and the souls which I have made.
Mic 7:18: Who is a God like to you: that pardons iniquity: and passs by the transgression of the remnant of His heritage? He retains not His anger for ever: because He delights in mercy.
Eph 4:26: 27: Be you angry: and not sin: not let the sun go down upon your wrath:
Eph 5:1: Be you therefore followers of God: as dear children;

"Teman"

"Bozrah"

Jer 49:13: 22: For I have sworn by myself: says the LORD: that Bozrah will become a desolation: a reproach: a waste: and a curse; and all the cities thereof will be perpetual wastes.

Judgment on the Ammonites

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמֹּ֔ון וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־בִּקְעָם֙ הָרֹ֣ות הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לְמַ֖עַן הַרְחִ֥יב אֶת־גְּבוּלָֽם׃

H3541כֹּ֚הkōh   (Adv)
H3541 כֹּה kôh ko from the prefix k and הוּא; properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now; also, here, + hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), + mean while, yonder., 		כֹּ֚הkōh Thus Adv

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- for Prep

13 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of the children of Ammon, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead, that they might enlarge their border:Amos 1:13
Stats
Rank: #4383 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 228 characters, 35 words, 183 letters, 65 vowels, 118 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמֹּ֔ון וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־בִּקְעָם֙ הָרֹ֣ות הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לְמַ֖עַן הַרְחִ֥יב אֶת־גְּבוּלָֽם׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of the sons of Ammon for four not I will turn away its punishment because they ripped open the pregnant women in Gilead that they might enlarge their territory

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of the children of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead, that they might enlarge their border:
References

"the children"
De 2:19: when you come nigh over against the children of Ammon: distress not them: nor meddle with them: for I not will give you of the land of the children of Ammon any possession; because I have given it to the children of Lot for a possession.
Jer 49:1-6: Concerning the Ammonites: thus says the LORD; Has Israel no sons? has He no heir? why then does their king inherit Gad: and His people dwell in His cities?
Eze 25:2-7: Son of man: set your face against the Ammonites: and prophesy against them;
Zep 2:8: I have heard the reproach of Moab: and the revilings of the children of Ammon: whereby they have reproached my people: and magnified themselves against their border.

"and for"
De 23:3: 4: An Ammonite or Moabite will not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to their tenth generation will not they enter into the congregation of the LORD for ever:
Jg 10:7-9: The anger of the LORD was hot against Israel: and He sold them into the hands of the Philistines: and into the hands of the children of Ammon.
Jg 11:15-28: Said to him: Thus says Jephthah: Israel not took away the land of Moab: nor the land of the children of Ammon:
1Sa 11:1: 2: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up: and encamped against Jabeshgilead: and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash: Make a covenant with us: and we will serve you.
2Sa 10:1-8: It came to pass after this: that the king of the children of Ammon died: and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
2Ki 24:2: The LORD sent against Him bands of the Chaldees: and bands of the Syrians: and bands of the Moabites: and bands of the children of Ammon: and sent them against Judah to destroy it: according to the word of the LORD: which He spoke by His servants the prophets.
2Ch 20:1: 10: It came to pass after this also: that the children of Moab: and the children of Ammon: and with them other beside the Ammonites: came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
Ne 2:19: But when Sanballat the Horonite: and Tobiah the servant: the Ammonite: and Geshem the Arabian: heard it: they laughed us to scorn: and despised us: and said: What is this thing that you do? will you rebel against the king?
Ne 4:7-23: But it came to pass: that when Sanballat: and Tobiah: and the Arabians: and the Ammonites: and the Ashdodites: heard that the walls of Jerusalem were made up: and that the breaches began to be stopped: then they were very angry:
Ps 83:7: Gebal: and Ammon: and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;

"because"
Ho 13:16: Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces: and their women with child will be ripped up.

"enlarge"
Isa 5:8: Woe to them that join house to house: that lay field to field: till there be no place: that they may be placed alone in the middle of the earth!
Jer 49:1: Concerning the Ammonites: thus says the LORD; Has Israel no sons? has He no heir? why then does their king inherit Gad: and His people dwell in His cities?
Eze 35:10: Because you have said: These two nations and these two countries will be my: and we will possess it; whereas the LORD was there:
Hab 2:5: 6: Yes also: because he transgresss by wine: he is a proud man: neither keeps at home: who enlarges his desire as hell: and is as death: and cannot be satisfied: but gathers to him all nations: and heaps to him all people:

 וְהִצַּ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּחֹומַ֣ת רַבָּ֔ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹותֶ֑יהָ בִּתְרוּעָה֙ בְּיֹ֣ום מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּסַ֖עַר בְּיֹ֥ום סוּפָֽה׃

14 But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it will devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind:Amos 1:14
Stats
Rank: #4269 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 168 characters, 31 words, 131 letters, 48 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהִצַּ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּחֹומַ֣ת רַבָּ֔ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹותֶ֑יהָ בִּתְרוּעָה֙ בְּיֹ֣ום מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּסַ֖עַר בְּיֹ֥ום סוּפָֽה׃

Lit: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah and it shall devour its palaces Amid shouting in the day of battle and a tempest in the day of the whirlwind

KJV: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind:
References

"Rabbah"
De 3:11: For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants; look: his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is not it in Rabbath of the children of Ammon? 9 cubits was the length thereof: and 4 cubits the breadth of it: after the cubit of a man.
2Sa 12:26: Joab fought against Rabbah of the children of Ammon: and took the royal city.
Jer 49:2: Therefore: look: the days come: says the LORD: that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it will be a desolate heap: and her daughters will be burned with fire: then will Israel be heir to them that were His heirs: says the LORD.
Eze 25:5: I will make Rabbah a stable for camels: and the Ammonites a couchingplace for flocks: and you will know that I am the LORD.

"with shouting"
Am 2:2: But I will send a fire upon Moab: and it will devour the palaces of Kerioth: and Moab will die with tumult: with shouting: and with the sound of the trumpet:
Job 39:25: He says among the trumpets: Ha: ha; and he smells the battle afar off: the thunder of the captains: and the shouting.
Isa 9:5: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise: and garments rolled in blood; but this will be with burning and fuel of fire.

"with a"
Ps 83:15: So persecute them with your tempest: and make them afraid with your storm.
Isa 30:30: The LORD will cause His glorious voice to be heard: and will show the lighting down of His arm: with the indignation of His anger: and with the flame of a devouring fire: with scattering: and tempest: and hailstones.
Da 11:40: At the time of the end will the king of the south push at him: and the king of the north will come against him like a whirlwind: with chariots: and with horsemen: and with many ships; and he will enter into the countries: and will overflow and pass over.
Zec 7:14: But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations whom they not knew. Thus the land was desolate after them: that no man passed through nor returned: for they laid the pleasant land desolate.

H1931ה֧וּאhū   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֧וּאhū He Pro-3ms

H8269 שַׂר sar sar from שָׂרַר; a head person (of any rank or class); captain (that had rule), chief (captain), general, governor, keeper, lord,(-task-)master, prince(-ipal), ruler, steward. 		וְשָׂרָ֛יוwə-śā-rāw and his princes Conj-w | N-mpc | 3ms

H559 אָמַר ʼâmar aw-mar a primitive root; to say (used with great latitude); answer, appoint, avouch, bid, boast self, call, certify, challenge, charge, phrase (at the, give) command(-ment), commune, consider, declare, demand, idiom desire, determine, idiom expressly, idiom indeed, idiom intend, name, idiom plainly, promise, publish, report, require, say, speak (against, of), idiom still, idiom suppose, talk, tell, term, idiom that is, idiom think, use (speech), utter, idiom verily, idiom yet. 		אָמַ֥ר’ā-mar says V-Qal-Perf-3ms

15 Their king will go into captivity, He and His princes together, says the LORD.Amos 1:15
Stats
Rank: #4105 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 84 characters, 13 words, 67 letters, 23 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהָלַ֥ךְ מַלְכָּ֖ם בַּגֹּולָ֑ה ה֧וּא וְשָׂרָ֛יו יַחְדָּ֖ו אָמַ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ פ

Lit: And shall go their king into captivity He and his princes together says Yahweh

KJV: And their king shall go into captivity, he and his princes together, saith the LORD.
References

"And their king shall go into captivity, he and his princes together, saith the LORD."
Jer 49:3: Howl: O Heshbon: for Ai is spoiled: cry: you daughters of Rabbah: gird you with sackcloth; lament: and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king will go into captivity: and his priests and his princes together.

2
Judgment on Moab

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י מֹואָ֔ב וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־שָׂרְפֹ֛ו עַצְמֹ֥ות מֶֽלֶךְ־אֱדֹ֖ום לַשִּֽׂיד׃

H3541כֹּ֚הkōh   (Adv)
H3541 כֹּה kôh ko from the prefix k and הוּא; properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now; also, here, + hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), + mean while, yonder., 		כֹּ֚הkōh Thus Adv

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- for Prep

1 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Moab, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because He burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:Amos 2:1
Stats
Rank: #7713 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 172 characters, 28 words, 136 letters, 52 vowels, 84 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י מֹואָ֔ב וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־שָׂרְפֹ֛ו עַצְמֹ֥ות מֶֽלֶךְ־אֱדֹ֖ום לַשִּֽׂיד׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Moab for four not I will turn away its punishment because he burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:
References

"For three"
Am 2:4: 6: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Judah: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD: and not have kept His commandments: and their lies caused them to err: after the which their fathers have walked:
Am 1:3: 6: 9: 11: 13: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Damascus: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:
Nu 22:1-25: The children of Israel set forward: and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan by Jericho.
De 23:4: 5: Because they met you not with bread and with water in the way: when you came forth out of Egypt; and because they hired against you Balaam the son of Beor of Pethor of Mesopotamia: to curse you.
Ps 83:4-7: They have said: Come: and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
Mic 6:5: O my people: remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted: and what Balaam the son of Beor answered Him from Shittim to Gilgal; that you may know the righteousness of the LORD.

"of Moab"
Isa 11:14: But they will fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west; they will spoil them of the east together: they will lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon will obey them.
Isa 15:1-16: The burden of Moab. Because in the night Ar of Moab is laid waste: and brought to silence; because in the night Kir of Moab is laid waste: and brought to silence;
Isa 25:10: For in this mountain will the hand of the LORD rest: and Moab will be trodden down under Him: even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.
Jer 48:1-47: Against Moab thus says the LORD of hosts: the God of Israel; Woe to Nebo! for it is spoiled: Kiriathaim is confounded and taken: Misgab is confounded and dismayed.
Eze 25:8: 9: Thus says the Lord GOD; Because that Moab and Seir do say: Look: the house of Judah is like to all the heathen;
Zep 2:8: 9: I have heard the reproach of Moab: and the revilings of the children of Ammon: whereby they have reproached my people: and magnified themselves against their border.

"because"
2Ki 3:9: 26: So the king of Israel went: and the king of Judah: and the king of Edom: and they fetched a compass of 7 days' journey: and there was no water for the host: and for the cattle that followed them.
Pr 15:3: The eyes of the LORD are in every place: beholding the evil and the good.

H7782שׁוֹפָֽר׃šō-w-p̄ār.   (N-ms)
H7782 שׁוֹפָר shôwphâr sho-far or שֹׁפָר; from שָׁפַר in the original sense of incising; a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn; cornet, trumpet. 		שׁוֹפָֽר׃šō-w-p̄ār. trumpet N-ms
2 But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it will devour the palaces of Kerioth: and Moab will die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet:Amos 2:2
Stats
Rank: #9381 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 159 characters, 27 words, 124 letters, 47 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־אֵ֣שׁ בְּמֹואָ֔ב וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹ֣ות הַקְּרִיֹּ֑ות וּמֵ֤ת בְּשָׁאֹון֙ מֹואָ֔ב בִּתְרוּעָ֖ה בְּקֹ֥ול שֹׁופָֽר׃

Lit: But I will send a fire upon Moab and it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth and shall die with tumult Moab with shouting and sound trumpet

KJV: But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet:
References

"Kirioth"
Jer 48:24: 41: Upon Kerioth: and upon Bozrah: and upon all the cities of the land of Moab: far or near.

"with tumult"
Am 1:14: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah: and it will devour the palaces thereof: with shouting in the day of battle: with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind:
Isa 9:5: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise: and garments rolled in blood; but this will be with burning and fuel of fire.
Jer 48:34: From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh: and even to Jahaz: have they uttered their voice: from Zoar even to Horonaim: as an heifer of 3 years old: for the waters also of Nimrim will be desolate.

Translation

Lit: And I will cut off the judge from its midst and all its princes slay with him says Yahweh

KJV: And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the LORD.
References

Jer 48:7: 25: For because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures: you will also be taken: and Chemosh will go forth into captivity with his priests and his princes together.

Judgment on Judah

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־מָאֳסָ֞ם אֶת־תֹּורַ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה וְחֻקָּיו֙ לֹ֣א שָׁמָ֔רוּ וַיַּתְעוּם֙ כִּזְבֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הָלְכ֥וּ אֲבֹותָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃

Counts: 276 characters, 42 words, 220 letters, 79 vowels, 141 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־מָאֳסָ֞ם אֶת־תֹּורַ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה וְחֻקָּיו֙ לֹ֣א שָׁמָ֔רוּ וַיַּתְעוּם֙ כִּזְבֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הָלְכ֥וּ אֲבֹותָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Judah for four not I will turn away its punishment because they have despised the law of Yahweh and His commandments not have kept and lead them astray their lies Lies which followed their fathers after

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after the which their fathers have walked:
References

"For"
De 31:16-18: The LORD said to Moses: Look: you will sleep with your fathers; and this people will rise up: and go a whoring after the gods of the strangers of the land: whither they go to be among them: and will forsake me: and break my covenant which I have made with them.
De 32:15-27: But Jeshurun waxed fat: and kicked: you are waxen fat: you are grown thick: you are covered with fatness; then He forsook God which made Him: and lightly esteemed the Rock of His salvation.

"Judah"
Am 3:2: You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.
2Ki 17:19: Also Judah not kept the commandments of the LORD their God: but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
Jer 9:25: 26: Look: the days come: says the LORD: that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;
Ho 5:12: 13: Therefore will I be to Ephraim as a moth: and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
Ho 6:11: Also: O Judah: he has set an harvest for you: when I returned the captivity of my people.
Ho 12:2: The LORD has also a controversy with Judah: and will punish Jacob according to His ways; according to His doings will He recompense Him.

"because"
Le 26:14: 15: But if you not will listen to me: and not will do all these commandments;
Jg 2:17-20: Yet they not would listen to their judges: but they went a whoring after other gods: and bowed themselves to them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in: obeying the commandments of the LORD; but they not did so.
2Sa 12:9: 10: For what reason have you despised the commandment of the LORD: to do evil in His sight? you have killed Uriah the Hittite with the sword: and have taken His wife to be your wife: and have killed Him with the sword of the children of Ammon.
2Ki 22:11-17: It came to pass: when the king had heard the words of the book of the law: that he tear his clothes.
2Ch 36:14-17: Moreover all the chief of the priests: and the people: transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen; and polluted the house of the LORD which He had hallowed in Jerusalem.
Ne 1:7: We have dealt very corruptly against you: and not have kept the commandments: nor the statutes: nor the judgments: which you commandedst your servant Moses.
Ne 9:26: 29: 30: Nevertheless they were disobedient: and rebelled against you: and cast your law behind their backs: and killed your prophets which testified against them to turn them to you: and they wrought great provocations.
Isa 5:24: 25: Therefore as the fire devours the stubble: and the flame consumes the chaff: so their root will be as rottenness: and their blossom will go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the LORD of hosts: and despised the word of the Holy one of Israel.
Jer 8:9: The wise men are ashamed: they are dismayed and taken: indeed: they have rejected the word of the LORD; and what wisdom is in them?
Eze 16:1-63: Again the word of the LORD came to me: saying:
Eze 20:13: 16: 24: But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness: they not walked in my statutes: and they despised my judgments: which if a man do: he will even live in them; and my sabbaths they greatly polluted: then I said: I would pour out my fury upon them in the wilderness: to consume them.
Eze 22:8: You have despised my holy things: and have profaned my sabbaths.
Eze 23:11-21: When her sister Aholibah saw this: she was more corrupt in her inordinate love than she: and in her whoredoms more than her sister in her whoredoms.
Da 9:5-12: We have sinned: and have committed iniquity: and have done wickedly: and have rebelled: even by departing from your precepts and from your judgments:
1Th 4:8: He therefore that despises'>despises: despises'>despises not man: but God: who has also given to us His holy Spirit.

"and their"
Isa 9:15: 16: The ancient and honourable: he is the head; and the prophet that teaches lies: he is the tail.
Isa 28:15: Because you have said: We have made a covenant with death: and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge will pass through: it will not come to us: for we have made lies our refuge: and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
Isa 44:20: He feeds on ashes: a deceived heart has turned him aside: that he cannot deliver his soul: nor say: Is there not a lie in my right hand?
Jer 16:19: 20: O LORD: my strength: and my fortress: and my refuge in the day of affliction: the Gentiles will come to you from the ends of the earth: and will say: Surely our fathers have inherited lies: vanity: and things wherein there is no profit.
Jer 23:13-15: 25-32: I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied in Baal: and caused my people Israel to err.
Jer 28:15: 16: Then said the prophet Jeremiah to Hananiah the prophet: Hear now: Hananiah; The LORD has not sent you; but you make this people to trust in a lie.
Eze 13:6-16: 22: They have seen vanity and lying divination: saying: The LORD says: and the LORD has not sent them: and they have made others to hope that they would confirm the word.
Eze 22:28: Her prophets have daubed them with untempered morter: seeing vanity: and divining lies to them: saying: Thus says the Lord GOD: when the LORD has not spoken.
Hab 2:18: What profits the graven image that the maker thereof has graven it; the molten image: and a teacher of lies: that the maker of his work trusts therein: to make dumb idols?
Ro 1:25: Who changed the truth of God into a lie: and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator: who is blessed for ever. Amen.

"after"
Jg 2:11-17: The children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD: and served Baalim:
Jg 10:6: The children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD: and served Baalim: and Ashtaroth: and the gods of Syria: and the gods of Zidon: and the gods of Moab: and the gods of the children of Ammon: and the gods of the Philistines: and forsook the LORD: and not served Him.
2Ch 30:7: not be you like your fathers: and like your brothers: which trespassed against the LORD God of their fathers: who therefore gave them up to desolation: as you see.
Jer 8:2: They will spread them before the sun: and the moon: and all the host of heaven: whom they have loved: and whom they have served: and after whom they have walked: and whom they have sought: and whom they have worshipped: they will not be gathered: nor be buried; they will be for dung upon the face of the earth.
Jer 9:14: But have walked after the imagination of their own heart: and after Baalim: which their fathers taught them:

1Pe 1:18: Forasmuch as you know that you not were redeemed with corruptible things: as silver and gold: from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers;

5 But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem.Amos 2:5
Stats
Rank: #5995 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 80 characters, 15 words, 63 letters, 26 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹ֥ות יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃ פ

Lit: But I will send a fire upon Judah and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem

KJV: But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
References

"I will"
Jer 17:27: But if you not will listen to me to hallow the sabbath day: not and to bear a burden: even entering in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof: and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem: and it will not be quenched.
Jer 21:10: For I have set my face against this city for evil: not and for good: says the LORD: it will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon: and He will burn it with fire.
Jer 37:8-10: The Chaldeans will come again: and fight against this city: and take it: and burn it with fire.
Jer 39:8: The Chaldeans burned the king's house: and the houses of the people: with fire: and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.
Jer 52:13: Burned the house of the LORD: and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem: and all the houses of the great men: burned He with fire:
Ho 8:14: For Israel has forgotten his Maker: and builds temples; and Judah has multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities: and it will devour the palaces thereof.

Judgment on Israel

כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־מִכְרָ֤ם בַּכֶּ֙סֶף֙ צַדִּ֔יק וְאֶבְיֹ֖ון בַּעֲב֥וּר נַעֲלָֽיִם׃

6 Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Israel, and for 4, I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;Amos 2:6
Stats
Rank: #8603 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 193 characters, 30 words, 153 letters, 58 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־מִכְרָ֤ם בַּכֶּ֙סֶף֙ צַדִּ֔יק וְאֶבְיֹ֖ון בַּעֲב֥וּר נַעֲלָֽיִם׃

Lit: Thus says Yahweh for three transgressions of Israel for four not I will turn away its punishment because they sell for silver the righteous and the poor for a pair of sandals

KJV: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;
References

"For three"
Am 6:3-7: You that put far away the evil day: and cause the seat of violence to come near;
2Ki 17:7-18: For so it was: that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God: which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt: from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt: and had feared other gods:
2Ki 18:12: Because they not obeyed the voice of the LORD their God: but transgressed His covenant: and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded: and not would hear them: nor do them.
Eze 23:5-9: Aholah played the harlot when she was my; and she doted on her lovers: on the Assyrians her neighbours:
Ho 4:1: 2: 11-14: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
Ho 7:7-10: They are all hot as an oven: and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calls to me.
Ho 8:4-6: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
Ho 13:2: 3: Now they sin more and more: and have made them molten images of their silver: and idols according to their own understanding: all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them: Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
Mic 6:10-16: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked: and the scant measure that is abominable?

"because"
Am 5:11: 12: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor: and you take from him burdens of wheat: you have built houses of cut stone: but you will not dwell in them; you have planted pleasant vineyards: but you will not drink wine of them.
Am 8:4-6: Hear this: O you that swallow up the needy: even to make the poor of the land to fail:
Isa 5:22: 23: Woe to them that are mighty to drink wine: and men of strength to mingle strong drink:
Isa 29:21: That make a man an offender for a word: and lay a snare for him that reproves in the gate: and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.
Joe 3:3: 6: They have cast lots for my people; and have given a boy for an harlot: and sold a girl for wine: that they might drink.
Mic 3:2: 3: Who hate the good: and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them: and their flesh from off their bones;

 הַשֹּׁאֲפִ֤ים עַל־עֲפַר־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ דַּלִּ֔ים וְדֶ֥רֶךְ עֲנָוִ֖ים יַטּ֑וּ וְאִ֣ישׁ וְאָבִ֗יו יֵֽלְכוּ֙ אֶל־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה לְמַ֥עַן חַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קָדְשִֽׁי׃

7 That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in to the same maid, to profane my holy name:Amos 2:7
Stats
Rank: #6183 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 179 characters, 37 words, 136 letters, 53 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַשֹּׁאֲפִ֤ים עַל־עֲפַר־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ דַּלִּ֔ים וְדֶ֥רֶךְ עֲנָוִ֖ים יַטּ֑וּ וְאִ֣ישׁ וְאָבִ֗יו יֵֽלְכוּ֙ אֶל־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה לְמַ֥עַן חַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קָדְשִֽׁי׃

Lit: they pant after the dust of the earth which is on the head of the poor and the way of the humble pervert and a man and his father go in to the same girl to defile name My holy

KJV: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in unto the same maid, to profane my holy name:
References

"pant"
Am 4:1: Hear this word: you cattle of Bashan: that are in the mountain of Samaria: which oppress the poor: which crush the needy: which say to their masters: Bring: and let us drink.
1Ki 21:4: Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him: for he had said: I not will give you the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid him down upon his bed: and turned away his face: and would eat no bread.
Pr 28:21: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.
Mic 2:2: 9: They covet fields: and take them by violence; and houses: and take them away: so they oppress a man and his house: even a man and his heritage.
Mic 7:2: 3: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.
Zep 3:3: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they not gnaw the bones till the morrow.

"and turn"
Am 5:12: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just: they take a bribe: and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
Isa 10:2: To turn aside the needy from judgment: and to take away the right from the poor of my people: that widows may be their prey: and that they may rob the fatherless!

"and a"
Le 18:8: 15: The nakedness of your father's wife will you not uncover: it is your father's nakedness.
Eze 22:11: One has committed abomination with his neighbour's wife; and another has lewdly defiled his daughter in law; and another in you has humbled his sister: his father's daughter.
1Co 5:1: It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you: and such fornication as not is so much as named among the Gentiles: that one should have his father's wife.

"to profane"
Le 20:3: I will set my face against that man: and will cut him off from among his people; because he has given of his seed to Molech: to defile my sanctuary: and to profane my holy name.
2Sa 12:14: Howbeit: because by this deed you have given great occasion to the enemies of the LORD to blaspheme: the child also that is born to you will surely die.
Eze 36:20: When they entered to the heathen: whither they went: they profaned my holy name: when they said to them: These are the people of the LORD: and are gone forth out of His land.
Ro 2:24: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you: as it is written.

H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃’ĕ-lō-hê-hem. of their god N-mpc | 3mp
8 They lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.Amos 2:8
Stats
Rank: #6853 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 24 words, 112 letters, 40 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַל־בְּגָדִ֤ים חֲבֻלִים֙ יַטּ֔וּ אֵ֖צֶל כָּל־מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וְיֵ֤ין עֲנוּשִׁים֙ יִשְׁתּ֔וּ בֵּ֖ית אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: And on clothes taken in pledge they lie down by every altar and the wine of the condemned drink in the house of their god

KJV: And they lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned [in] the house of their god.
References

"laid"
Ex 22:26: 27: If you at all take your neighbour's clothing to pledge: you will deliver it to him by that the sun goes down:
De 24:12-17: If the man be poor: you will not sleep with his pledge:
Eze 18:7: 12: has not oppressed any: but has restored to the debtor his pledge: has spoiled none by violence: has given his bread to the hungry: and has covered the naked with a garment;

"by"
Am 6:4: That lie upon beds of ivory: and stretch themselves upon their couches: and eat the lambs out of the flock: and the calves out of the middle of the stall;
Isa 57:7: Upon a lofty and high mountain have you set your bed: even there went you up to offer sacrifice.
Eze 23:41: sat upon a stately bed: and a table prepared before it: whereupon you have set my incense and my oil.
1Co 8:10: For if any man see you which have knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple: will not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;
1Co 10:7: 21: Neither be you idolaters: as were some of them; as it is written: The people sat down to eat and drink: and rose up to play.

"they drink"
Am 6:6: That drink wine in bowls: and anoint themselves with the chief ointments: but they not are grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Jg 9:27: They went out into the fields: and gathered their vineyards: and trode the grapes: and made merry: and went into the house of their god: and did eat and drink: and cursed Abimelech.
Ho 4:8: They eat up the sin of my people: and they set their heart on their iniquity.

 וְאָ֨נֹכִ֜י הִשְׁמַ֤דְתִּי אֶת־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר כְּגֹ֤בַהּ אֲרָזִים֙ גָּבְהֹ֔ו וְחָסֹ֥ן ה֖וּא כָּֽאַלֹּונִ֑ים וָאַשְׁמִ֤יד פִּרְיֹו֙ מִמַּ֔עַל וְשָׁרָשָׁ֖יו מִתָּֽחַת׃

9 Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.Amos 2:9
Stats
Rank: #6545 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 187 characters, 29 words, 146 letters, 56 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָ֨נֹכִ֜י הִשְׁמַ֤דְתִּי אֶת־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר כְּגֹ֤בַהּ אֲרָזִים֙ גָּבְהֹ֔ו וְחָסֹ֥ן ה֖וּא כָּֽאַלֹּונִ֑ים וָאַשְׁמִ֤יד פִּרְיֹו֙ מִמַּ֔עַל וְשָׁרָשָׁ֖יו מִתָּֽחַת׃

Lit: And yet it was I who destroyed the Amorite before them Whose like height was the cedars the height and as strong he was as the oaks and yet I destroyed his fruit above and his roots beneath

KJV: Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he [was] strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

10 Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you 40 years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.Amos 2:10
Stats
Rank: #7566 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 129 characters, 23 words, 102 letters, 37 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י הֶעֱלֵ֥יתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֹולֵ֨ךְ אֶתְכֶ֤ם בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃

Lit: And it was I who brought up you from the land of Egypt and led you through the wilderness forty years to possess the land of the Amorite

KJV: Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
References

"I bought"

"and led"

De 2:7: For the LORD your God has blessed you in all the works of your hand: He knows your walking through this great wilderness: these 40 years the LORD your God has been with you; you have not lackedhing.
De 8:2-4: you will remember all the way which the LORD your God led you these 40 years in the wilderness: to humble you: and to prove you: to know what was in your heart: whether you would keep His commandments: or no.
Ne 9:21: Yes: 40 years did you sustain them in the wilderness: so that they not lackedhing; their clothes not waxed old: and their feet not swelled.
Ps 95:10: 40 years long was I grieved with this generation: and said: It is a people that do err in their heart: and they not have known my ways:
Ac 7:42: Then God turned: and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets: O you house of Israel: have you offered to me killed beasts and sacrifices by the space of 40 years in the wilderness?
Ac 13:18: About the time of 40 years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

"to possess"
Nu 14:31-35: But your little ones: which you said should be a prey: them will I bring in: and they will know the land which you have despised.
De 1:20: 21: 39: I said to you: You are come to the mountain of the Amorites: which the LORD our God does give to us.

11 I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O you children of Israel? says the LORD.Amos 2:11
Stats
Rank: #7876 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 141 characters, 25 words, 108 letters, 43 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וָאָקִ֤ים מִבְּנֵיכֶם֙ לִנְבִיאִ֔ים וּמִבַּחוּרֵיכֶ֖ם לִנְזִרִ֑ים הַאַ֥ף אֵֽין־זֹ֛את בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהוָֽה׃

Lit: And I raised up some of your sons as prophets and some of your young men as Nazirites [Is it not this you sons of Israel says Yahweh

KJV: And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the LORD.

"I raised"

13 Look, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves.Amos 2:13
Stats
Rank: #9210 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 77 characters, 14 words, 59 letters, 23 vowels, 36 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י מֵעִ֖יק תַּחְתֵּיכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר תָּעִיק֙ הָעֲגָלָ֔ה הַֽמְלֵאָ֥ה לָ֖הּ עָמִֽיר׃

Lit: Behold I am weighed down by you as is weighed down a cart full of sheaves

KJV: Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves.
References

"Behold"
Ps 78:40: How often did they provoke him in the wilderness: and grieve him in the desert!
Isa 1:14: your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hates: they are a trouble to me; I am weary to bear them.
Isa 7:13: He said: Hear you now: O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men: but will you weary my God also?
Isa 43:24: You have bought me no sweet cane with money: neither have you filled me with the fat of your sacrifices: but you have made me to serve with your sins: you have wearied me with your iniquities.
Eze 6:9: They that escape of you will remember me among the nations whither they will be carried captives: because I am broken with their whorish heart: which has departed from me: and with their eyes: which go a whoring after their idols: and they will lothe themselves for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
Eze 16:43: Because you have not remembered the days of your youth: but have fretted me in all these things; look: therefore I also will recompense your way upon your head: says the Lord GOD: and you will not commit this lewdness above all your abominations.
Mal 2:17: You have wearied the LORD with your words. Yet you say: Wherein have we wearied Him? When you say: Every one that does evil is good in the sight of the LORD: and He delights in them; or: Where is the God of judgment?

 וְאָבַ֤ד מָנֹוס֙ מִקָּ֔ל וְחָזָ֖ק לֹא־יְאַמֵּ֣ץ כֹּחֹ֑ו וְגִבֹּ֖ור לֹא־יְמַלֵּ֥ט נַפְשֹֽׁו׃

14 Therefore the flight will perish from the swift, and the strong will not strengthen his force, neither will the mighty deliver himself:Amos 2:14
Stats
Rank: #9614 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 138 characters, 20 words, 114 letters, 33 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָבַ֤ד מָנֹוס֙ מִקָּ֔ל וְחָזָ֖ק לֹא־יְאַמֵּ֣ץ כֹּחֹ֑ו וְגִבֹּ֖ור לֹא־יְמַלֵּ֥ט נַפְשֹֽׁו׃

Lit: Therefore shall perish flight from the swift and the strong not shall strengthen his power and the mighty nor shall deliver himself

KJV: Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver himself:

"the flight"

Jer 9:23: Thus says the LORD: not Let the wise man glory in His wisdom: neither let the mighty man glory in His might: not let the rich man glory in His riches:

15 Neither will he stand that handles the bow; and he who is swift of foot will not deliver himself: neither will he who rids the horse deliver himself.Amos 2:15
Stats
Counts: 159 characters, 25 words, 127 letters, 42 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְתֹפֵ֤שׂ הַקֶּ֙שֶׁת֙ לֹ֣א יַעֲמֹ֔ד וְקַ֥ל בְּרַגְלָ֖יו לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּ֑ט וְרֹכֵ֣ב הַסּ֔וּס לֹ֥א יְמַלֵּ֖ט נַפְשֹֽׁו׃

Lit: And who handles the bow not He shall stand and the swift of foot not shall escape and he who rides a horse nor shall deliver himself

KJV: Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver [himself]: neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself.

16 He that'>He who is courageous among the mighty will flee away naked in that day, says the LORD.Amos 2:16
