H3619כְּל֣וּבkə-lūḇ   (N-msc)
H3619 כְּלוּב kᵉlûwb kel-oob xlit kᵉlûb corrected to kᵉlûwb; from the same as כֶּלֶב; a bird-trap (as furnished with a clap-stick or treadle to spring it); hence, a basket (as resembling a wicker cage); basket, cage. 		כְּל֣וּבkə-lūḇ a basket N-msc

H413אֵלַ֗י’ê-lay,   (Prep | 1cs)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		אֵלַ֗י’ê-lay, to me Prep | 1cs

H3808לֹא־lō-   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹא־lō- not Adv-NegPrt

H5674עֲב֥וֹר‘ă-ḇō-wr   (V-Qal-Inf)
H5674 עָבַר ʻâbar aw-bar a primitive root; to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation); alienate, alter, idiom at all, beyond, bring (over, through), carry over, (over-) come (on, over), conduct (over), convey over, current, deliver, do away, enter, escape, fail, gender, get over, (make) go (away, beyond, by, forth, his way, in, on, over, through), have away (more), lay, meddle, overrun, make partition, (cause to, give, make to, over) pass(-age, along, away, beyond, by, -enger, on, out, over, through), (cause to, make) phrase proclaim(-amation), perish, provoke to anger, put away, rage, phrase raiser of taxes, remove, send over, set apart, phrase shave, cause to (make) sound, idiom speedily, idiom sweet smelling, take (away), (make to) transgress(-or), translate, turn away, (way-) faring man, be wrath. 		עֲב֥וֹר‘ă-ḇō-wr I will pass by V-Qal-Inf
Hלֽוֹ׃lōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		לֽוֹ׃lōw. them Prep | 3ms
2 He said, Amos, what see you? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then said the LORD to me, The end is come upon my people of Israel; I not will again pass by them any more.Amos 8:2
Stats
Counts: 183 characters, 32 words, 137 letters, 56 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָֽה־אַתָּ֤ה רֹאֶה֙ עָמֹ֔וס וָאֹמַ֖ר כְּל֣וּב קָ֑יִץ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י בָּ֤א הַקֵּץ֙ אֶל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־אֹוסִ֥יף עֹ֖וד עֲבֹ֥ור לֹֽו׃

Lit: And He said what you do see Amos so I said a basket of summer fruit And said Yahweh to me has come the end upon My people Israel not again them anymore I will pass by them

KJV: And he said, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then said the LORD unto me, The end is come upon my people of Israel; I will not again pass by them any more.
References

"Amos"
Am 7:8: The LORD said to me: Amos: what see you? And I said: A plumbline. Then said the Lord: Look: I will set a plumbline in the middle of my people Israel: I not will again pass by them any more:
Jer 1:11-14: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me: saying: Jeremiah: what see you? And I said: I see a rod of an almond tree.
Eze 8:6: 12: 17: He said furthermore to me: Son of man: see you what they do? even the great abominations that the house of Israel commits here: that I should go far off from my sanctuary? but turn you yet again: and you will see greater abominations.
Zec 1:18-21: Then lifted I up my eyes: and saw: and look 4 horns.
Zec 5:2: 5: 6: He said to me: What see you? And I answered: I see a flying roll; the length thereof is 20 cubits: and the breadth thereof 10 cubits.

"A basket"
De 26:1-4: It will be: when you are come in to the land which the LORD your God gives you for an inheritance: and possess it: and dwell therein;
2Sa 16:1: 2: When David was a little past the top of the hill: look: Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him: with a couple of asses saddled: and upon them 200 loaves of bread: and 100 bunches of raisins: and 100 of summer fruits: and a bottle of wine.
Isa 28:4: The glorious beauty: which is on the head of the fat valley: will be a fading flower: and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he who looks upon it sees: while it is yet in his hand he eats it up.
Jer 24:1-3: The LORD showed me: and: look: two baskets of figs were set before the temple of the LORD: after that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah: and the princes of Judah: with the carpenters and smiths: from Jerusalem: and had brought them to Babylon.
Jer 40:10: As for me: look: I will dwell at Mizpah to serve the Chaldeans: which will come to us: but you: gather you wine: and summer fruits: and oil: and put them in your vessels: and dwell in your cities that you have taken.
Mic 7:1: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits: as the grapegleanings of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my soul desired the firstripe fruit.

"the end"
Jer 1:12: Then said the LORD to me: You have well seen: for I will hasten my word to perform it.
Jer 5:31: The prophets prophesy falsely: and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will you do in the end thereof?
La 4:18: They hunt our steps: that we cannot go in our streets: our end is near: our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.
Eze 7:2: Also: you son of man: thus says the Lord GOD to the land of Israel; An end: the end is come upon the 4 corners of the land.
Eze 3:7: 10: But the house of Israel not will listen to you; for they not will listen to me: for all the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.
Eze 12:23: Tell them therefore: Thus says the Lord GOD; I will make this proverb to cease: and they will no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but say to them: The days are at hand: and the effect of every vision.
Eze 29:8: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will bring a sword upon you: and cut off man and beast out of you.

"I will not"
Am 7:8: The LORD said to me: Amos: what see you? And I said: A plumbline. Then said the Lord: Look: I will set a plumbline in the middle of my people Israel: I not will again pass by them any more:

H2013הָֽס׃hās.   (Interjection)

3 The songs of the temple will be howlings in that day, says the Lord GOD: there will be many dead bodies in every place; they will cast them forth with silence.Amos 8:3
Stats
Counts: 169 characters, 27 words, 132 letters, 43 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהֵילִ֜ילוּ שִׁירֹ֤ות הֵיכָל֙ בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֔וּא נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֑ה רַ֣ב הַפֶּ֔גֶר בְּכָל־מָקֹ֖ום הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ הָֽס׃ פ

Lit: And shall be wailing the songs of the temple in day that says the Lord GOD Many dead bodies everywhere everywhere they shall be thrown out in silence

KJV: And the songs of the temple shall be howlings in that day, saith the Lord GOD: there shall be many dead bodies in every place; they shall cast [them] forth with silence.
References

"the songs"
Am 8:10: I will turn your feasts into mourning: and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins: and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son: and the end thereof as a bitter day.
Am 5:23: Take you away from me the noise of your songs; for I not will hear the melody of your viols.
Ho 10:5: 6: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
Joe 1:5: 11: 13: Awake: you drunkards: and weep; and howl: all you drinkers of wine: because of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.
Zec 11:1-3: Open your doors: O Lebanon: that the fire may devour your cedars.

"many"
Am 4:10: I have sent among you the pestilence after the manner of Egypt: your young men have I killed with the sword: and have taken away your horses; and I have made the stink of your camps to come up to your nostrils: yet have you not returned to me: says the LORD.
Isa 37:36: Then the angel of the LORD went forth: and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a00 and fourscore and 5000: and when they arose early in the morning: look: they were all dead corpses.
Jer 9:21: 22: For death is come up into our windows: and is entered into our palaces: to cut off the children from without: and the young men from the streets.
Na 3:3: The horseman lifts up both the bright sword and the glittering spear: and there is a multitude of killed: and a great number of carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumble upon their corpses:

"they shall"
Am 6:9: 10: It will come to pass: if there remain 10 men in one house: that they will die.
Jer 22:18: Therefore thus says the LORD concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah; They will not lament for Him: saying: Ah my brother! or: Ah sister! they will not lament for Him: saying: Ah lord! or: Ah His glory!

"with silence"
Le 10:3: Then Moses said to Aaron: This is it that the LORD spoke: saying: I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me: and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held His peace.
Ps 39:9: I was dumb: I not opened my mouth; because you did it.

4 Hear this, O you that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,Amos 8:4
Stats
Counts: 85 characters, 17 words, 64 letters, 26 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֕את הַשֹּׁאֲפִ֖ים אֶבְיֹ֑ון וְלַשְׁבִּ֖ית [עַנְוֵי־ כ] (עֲנִיֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ק)

Lit: Hear this you who swallow up the needy and make fail the poor of the land

KJV: Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,
References

"Hear"
Am 7:16: Now therefore hear you the word of the LORD: You say: not Prophesy against Israel: and not drop your word against the house of Isaac.
1Ki 22:19: He said: Hear you therefore the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on His throne: and all the host of heaven standing by Him on His right hand and on His left.
Isa 1:10: Hear the word of the LORD: you rulers of Sodom; give ear to the law of our God: you people of Gomorrah.
Isa 28:14: For what reason hear the word of the LORD: you scornful men: that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.
Jer 5:21: Hear now this: O foolish people: and without understanding; which have eyes: and not see; which have ears: and not hear:
Jer 28:15: Then said the prophet Jeremiah to Hananiah the prophet: Hear now: Hananiah; The LORD has not sent you; but you make this people to trust in a lie.

"swallow"
Am 2:6: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Israel: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver: and the poor for a pair of shoes;
Am 5:11: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor: and you take from him burdens of wheat: you have built houses of cut stone: but you will not dwell in them; you have planted pleasant vineyards: but you will not drink wine of them.
Ps 12:5: For the oppression of the poor: for the sighing of the needy: now will I arise: says the LORD; I will set Him in safety from Him that puffeth at Him.
Ps 14:4: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: and not call upon the LORD.
Ps 56:1: Michtam of David: when the Philistines took Him in Gath.>> Be merciful to me: O God: for man would swallow me up; He fighting daily oppresss me.
Ps 140:12: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted: and the right of the poor.

Jas 5:6: You have condemned and killed the just; and he does not resist you.

5 Saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell grain? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small, and the shekel great, and falsifying the balances by deceit?Amos 8:5
Stats
Counts: 193 characters, 29 words, 150 letters, 50 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר מָתַ֞י יַעֲבֹ֤ר הַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ וְנַשְׁבִּ֣ירָה שֶּׁ֔בֶר וְהַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וְנִפְתְּחָה־בָּ֑ר לְהַקְטִ֤ין אֵיפָה֙ וּלְהַגְדִּ֣יל שֶׁ֔קֶל וּלְעַוֵּ֖ת מֹאזְנֵ֥י מִרְמָֽה׃

Lit: Saying when will be past the New Moon that we may sell grain and the Sabbath that we may trade wheat Making small the ephah and large the shekel and Falsifying the scales by deceit

KJV: Saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell corn? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small, and the shekel great, and falsifying the balances by deceit?
References

"When"
Nu 10:10: Also in the day of your gladness: and in your solemn days: and in the beginnings of your months: you will blow with the trumpets over your burnt offerings: and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; that they may be to you for a memorial before your God: I am the LORD your God.
Nu 28:11-15: In the beginnings of your months you will offer a burnt offering to the LORD; two young bullocks: and one ram: 7 lambs of the first year without spot;
2Ki 4:23: He said: For what reason will you go to him today? it is neither new moon: nor sabbath. And she said: It will be well.
Ps 81:3: 4: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon: in the time appointed: on our solemn feast day.
Isa 1:13: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination to me; the new moons and sabbaths: the calling of assemblies: I cannot away with; it is iniquity: even the solemn meeting.
Col 2:16: Let no man therefore judge you in meat: or in drink: or in respect of an holyday: or of the new moon: or of the sabbath days:

"be gone"
Mal 1:13: You said also: Look: what a weariness is it! and you have snuffed at it: says the LORD of hosts; and you brought that which was torn: and the lame: and the sick; thus you brought an offering: should I accept this of your hand? says the LORD.

"and the"
Ex 20:8-10: Remember the sabbath day: to keep it holy.
Ne 13:15-21: In those days saw I in Judah some treading wine presses on the sabbath: and bringing in sheaves: and lading asses; as also wine: grapes: and figs: and all manner of burdens: which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day wherein they sold victuals.
Isa 58:13: If you turn away your foot from the sabbath: from doing your pleasure on my holy day; and call the sabbath a delight: the holy of the LORD: honourable; and will honour Him: not doing your own ways: nor finding your own pleasure: nor speaking your own words:
Ro 8:6: 7: For to be carnally minded is death; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace.

"making"
Le 19:36: Just balances: just weights: a just ephah: and a just hin: will you have: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt.
De 25:13-16: You will not have in your bag divers weights: a great and a small.
Pr 11:1: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is His delight.
Pr 16:11: A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are His work.
Pr 20:23: Divers weights are an abomination to the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
Eze 45:10-12: You will have just balances: and a just ephah: and a just bath.
Mic 6:10: 11: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked: and the scant measure that is abominable?

"falsifying the balances by deceit"
Ho 12:7: He is a merchant: the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loves to oppress.

H1250 בָּר bâr bawr or בַּר; from בָּרַר (in the sense of winnowing); grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country; corn, wheat. 		בַּ֖רbar the wheat N-ms

Counts: 110 characters, 21 words, 83 letters, 33 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation

Lit: that we may buy for silver the poor and the needy for a pair of sandals and Even bad the wheat sell

KJV: That we may buy the poor for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes; yea, and sell the refuse of the wheat?

Joe 3:3: 6: They have cast lots for my people; and have given a boy for an harlot: and sold a girl for wine: that they might drink.

7 The LORD has sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.Amos 8:7
Stats
Counts: 94 characters, 17 words, 75 letters, 24 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה בִּגְאֹ֣ון יַעֲקֹ֑ב אִם־אֶשְׁכַּ֥ח לָנֶ֖צַח כָּל־מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃

Lit: has sworn Yahweh by the pride of Jacob surely I will forget never any of their works

KJV: The LORD hath sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.
References

"sworn"

De 33:26-29: There is none like to the God of Jeshurun: who rids upon the heaven in your help: and in His excellency on the sky.
Ps 47:4: He will choose our inheritance for us: the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
Ps 68:34: Ascribe you strength to God: His excellency is over Israel: and His strength is in the clouds.
Lu 2:32: A light to lighten the Gentiles: and the glory of your people Israel.

"I will"

1Sa 15:2: 3: Thus says the LORD of hosts: I remember that which Amalek did to Israel: how He laid wait for Him in the way: when He came up from Egypt.
Ps 10:11: He has said in His heart: God has forgotten: He hides His face; He will never see it.
Isa 43:25: I: even I: am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake: and not will remember your sins.
Jer 17:1: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron: and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart: and upon the horns of your altars;
Jer 31:34: They will teach no more every man His neighbour: and every man His brother: saying: Know the LORD: for they will all know me: from the least of them to the great of them: says the LORD: for I will forgive their iniquity: and I will remember their sin no more.
Ho 7:2: They not consider in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.
Ho 8:13: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings: and eat it; but the LORD accepts not them; now will He remember their iniquity: and visit their sins: they will return to Egypt.
Ho 9:9: They have deeply corrupted themselves: as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity: he will visit their sins.

8 Will not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwells therein? and it will rise up wholly as a flood; and it will be cast out and drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.Amos 8:8
Stats
Counts: 183 characters, 33 words, 142 letters, 48 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַ֤עַל זֹאת֙ לֹֽא־תִרְגַּ֣ז הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאָבַ֖ל כָּל־יֹושֵׁ֣ב בָּ֑הּ וְעָלְתָ֤ה כָאֹר֙ כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְנִגְרְשָׁ֥ה [וְנִשְׁקָה כ] (וְנִשְׁקְעָ֖ה ק) כִּיאֹ֥ור מִצְרָֽיִם׃ ס

Lit: Shall for this not tremble the land and mourn everyone who dwells in it and shall swell like the Nile all of it and Heave and subside Like the Nile of Egypt

KJV: Shall not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholly as a flood; and it shall be cast out and drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.
References

"the land"
Ps 18:7: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken: because he was angry.
Ps 60:2: 3: You have made the earth to tremble; you have broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shakes.
Ps 114:3-7: The sea saw it: and fled: Jordan was driven back.
Isa 5:25: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against His people: and He has stretched forth His hand against them: and has smitten them: and the hills did tremble: and their carcases were torn in the middle of the streets. For all this His anger not is turned away: but His hand is stretched out still.
Isa 24:19: 20: The earth is utterly broken down: the earth is clean dissolved: the earth is moved exceedingly.
Jer 4:24-26: I beheld the mountains: and: indeed: they trembled: and all the hills moved lightly.
Mic 1:3-5: For: look: the LORD comes forth out of His place: and will come down: and tread upon the high places of the earth.
Na 1:5: 6: The mountains quake at him: and the hills melt: and the earth is burned at his presence: yes: the world: and all that dwell therein.
Hab 3:5-8: Before him went the pestilence: and burning coals went forth at his feet.
Hag 2:6: 7: For thus says the LORD of hosts; Yet once: it is a little while: and I will shake the heavens: and the earth: and the sea: and the dry land;

"every one"
Am 8:10: I will turn your feasts into mourning: and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins: and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son: and the end thereof as a bitter day.
Am 9:5: The Lord GOD of hosts is He that'>He who touches the land: and it will melt: and all that dwell therein will mourn: and it will rise up wholly like a flood; and will be drowned: as by the flood of Egypt.
Jer 12:4: How long will the land mourn: and the herbs of every field where: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed: and the birds; because they said: He will not see our last end.
Ho 4:3: Therefore will the land mourn: and every one that dwells therein will languish: with the beasts of the field: and with the fowls of heaven; yes: the fishes of the sea also will be taken away.
Ho 10:5: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
Mt 24:30: Then will appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then will all the tribes of the earth mourn: and they will see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

"rise"
Am 9:5: The Lord GOD of hosts is He that'>He who touches the land: and it will melt: and all that dwell therein will mourn: and it will rise up wholly like a flood; and will be drowned: as by the flood of Egypt.
Isa 8:7: 8: Now therefore: look: the Lord brings up upon them the waters of the river: strong and many: even the king of Assyria: and all His glory: and He will come up over all His channels: and go over all His banks:
Jer 46:8: Egypt rises up like a flood: and his waters are moved like the rivers; and he says: I will go up: and will cover the earth; I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.
Da 9:26: After threescore and two weeks will Messiah be cut off: not but for himself: and the people of the prince that will come will destroy the city and the sanctuary; and the end thereof will be with a flood: and to the end of the war desolations are determined.

 וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֗וּא נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֔ה וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ בַּֽצָּהֳרָ֑יִם וְהַחֲשַׁכְתִּ֥י לָאָ֖רֶץ בְּיֹ֥ום אֹֽור׃

H1961וְהָיָ֣ה ׀wə-hā-yāh   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms)
H1961 הָיָה hâyâh haw-yaw a primitive root (compare הָוָא); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, idiom altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall, phrase follow, happen, idiom have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, idiom use. 		וְהָיָ֣ה ׀wə-hā-yāh And it shall come to pass Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms
H3117בַּיּ֣וֹםbay-yō-wm   (Prep-b, Art | N-ms)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		בַּיּ֣וֹםbay-yō-wm in day Prep-b, Art | N-ms
H1931הַה֗וּאha-hū,   (Art | Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הַה֗וּאha-hū, that Art | Pro-3ms

H3069 יְהֹוִה Yᵉhôvih yeh-ho-vee a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God. 		יְהוִ֔הYah-weh, GOD N-proper-ms

H216 אוֹר ʼôwr ore from אוֹר; illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.); bright, clear, phrase day, light (-ning), morning, sun. 		אֽוֹר׃’ō-wr. broad N-cs
9 It will come to pass in that day, says the Lord GOD, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the earth in the clear day:Amos 8:9
Stats
Counts: 150 characters, 31 words, 113 letters, 42 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֗וּא נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֔ה וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ בַּֽצָּהֳרָ֑יִם וְהַחֲשַׁכְתִּ֥י לָאָ֖רֶץ בְּיֹ֥ום אֹֽור׃

Lit: And it shall come to pass in day that says the Lord GOD that I will make go down the sun at noon and I will darken the earth in daylight broad

KJV: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord GOD, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the earth in the clear day:
References

"that I"
Am 4:13: For: indeed: He that'>He who forms the mountains: and creates the wind: and declares to man what is His thought: that makes the morning darkness: and treads upon the high places of the earth: The LORD: The God of hosts: is His name.
Am 5:8: Seek Him that makes'>makes the 7 stars and Orion: and turns the shadow of death into the morning: and makes'>makes the day dark with night: that calls for the waters of the sea: and pours them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is His name:
Job 5:14: They meet with darkness in the daytime: and grope in the noonday as in the night.
Isa 13:10: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof will not give their light: the sun will be darkened in his going forth: and the moon will not cause her light to shine.
Isa 29:9: 10: Stay yourselves: and wonder; cry you out: and cry: they are drunken: not but with wine; they stagger: not but with strong drink.
Isa 59:9: 10: Therefore is judgment far from us: neither does justice overtake us: we wait for light: but look obscurity; for brightness: but we walk in darkness.
Jer 15:9: She that has borne 7 languishes: she has given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she has been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies: says the LORD.
Mic 3:6: Therefore night will be to you: that you will not have a vision; and it will be dark to you: that you will not divine; and the sun will go down over the prophets: and the day will be dark over them.
Mt 24:29: Immediately after the tribulation of those days will the sun be darkened: and the moon will not give her light: and the stars will fall from heaven: and the powers of the heavens will be shaken:
Re 6:12: I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal: and: indeed: there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair: and the moon became as blood;
Re 8:12: The fourth angel sounded: and the third part of the sun was smitten: and the third part of the moon: and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened: and the day not shone for a third part of it: and the night likewise.

"and I"
Ex 10:21-23: The LORD said to Moses: Stretch out your hand toward heaven: that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt: even darkness which may be felt.
Mt 27:45: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land to the ninth hour.
Mr 15:33: When the sixth hour was come: there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
Lu 23:44: It was about the sixth hour: and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

 וְהָפַכְתִּ֨י חַגֵּיכֶ֜ם לְאֵ֗בֶל וְכָל־שִֽׁירֵיכֶם֙ לְקִינָ֔ה וְהַעֲלֵיתִ֤י עַל־כָּל־מָתְנַ֙יִם֙ שָׂ֔ק וְעַל־כָּל־רֹ֖אשׁ קָרְחָ֑ה וְשַׂמְתִּ֙יהָ֙ כְּאֵ֣בֶל יָחִ֔יד וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ כְּיֹ֥ום מָֽר׃

10 I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son, and the end thereof as a bitter day.Amos 8:10
Stats
Rank: #4166 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 243 characters, 43 words, 190 letters, 72 vowels, 118 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהָפַכְתִּ֨י חַגֵּיכֶ֜ם לְאֵ֗בֶל וְכָל־שִֽׁירֵיכֶם֙ לְקִינָ֔ה וְהַעֲלֵיתִ֤י עַל־כָּל־מָתְנַ֙יִם֙ שָׂ֔ק וְעַל־כָּל־רֹ֖אשׁ קָרְחָ֑ה וְשַׂמְתִּ֙יהָ֙ כְּאֵ֣בֶל יָחִ֔יד וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ כְּיֹ֥ום מָֽר׃

Lit: And I will turn your feasts into mourning and all your songs into lamentation and I will bring on every waist sackcloth and on every head baldness and I will make it like mourning for an only son and its end like a day bitter

KJV: And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son, and the end thereof as a bitter day.
References

"I will turn"
Am 8:3: The songs of the temple will be howlings in that day: says the Lord GOD: there will be many dead bodies in every place; they will cast them forth with silence.
Am 5:23: Take you away from me the noise of your songs; for I not will hear the melody of your viols.
Am 6:4-7: That lie upon beds of ivory: and stretch themselves upon their couches: and eat the lambs out of the flock: and the calves out of the middle of the stall;
De 16:14: you will rejoice in your feast: you: and your son: and your daughter: and your manservant: and your maidservant: and the Levite: the stranger: and the fatherless: and the widow: that are within your gates.
1Sa 25:36-38: Abigail came to Nabal; and: look: he held a feast in his house: like the feast of a king; and Nabal's heart was merry within him: for he was very drunken: for what reason she told not himhing: less or more: until the morning light.
2Sa 13:28-31: Now Absalom had commanded his servants: saying: Mark you now when Amnon's heart is merry with wine: and when I say to you: Smite Amnon; then kill him: not fear: not have I commanded you? be courageous: and be valiant.
Job 20:23: When He is about to fill His belly: God will cast the fury of His wrath upon Him: and will rain it upon Him while He is eating.
Isa 21:3: 4: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me: as the pangs of a woman that travails: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
Isa 22:12-14: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Da 5:4-6: They drank wine: and praised the gods of gold: and of silver: of brass: of iron: of wood: and of stone.
Ho 2:11: I will also cause all her mirth to cease: her feast days: her new moons: and her sabbaths: and all her solemn feasts.
Na 1:10: For while they be folden together as thorns: and while they are drunken as drunkards: they will be devoured as stubble fully dry.

"sackcloth"
Isa 15:2: 3: He is gone up to Bajith: and to Dibon: the high places: to weep: Moab will howl over Nebo: and over Medeba: on all their heads will be baldness: and every beard cut off.
Jer 48:37: For every head will be bald: and every beard clipped: upon all the hands will be cuttings: and upon the loins sackcloth.
Eze 7:18: They will also gird themselves with sackcloth: and horror will cover them; and shame will be upon all faces: and baldness upon all their heads.
Eze 27:30: 31: will cause their voice to be heard against you: and will cry bitterly: and will cast up dust upon their heads: they will wallow themselves in the ashes:

"as the"
Jer 6:26: O daughter of my people: gird you with sackcloth: and wallow yourself in ashes: make you mourning: as for an only son: most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler will suddenly come upon us.
Zec 12:10: I will pour upon the house of David: and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem: the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they will look upon me whom they have pierced: and they will mourn for him: as one mourns for his only son: and will be in bitterness for him: as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
Lu 7:12: 13: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city: look: there was a dead man carried out: the only son of his mother: and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.

"a bitter"
Job 3:5: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִ֗ים נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֔ה וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹֽא־רָעָ֤ב לַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ וְלֹֽא־צָמָ֣א לַמַּ֔יִם כִּ֣י אִם־לִשְׁמֹ֔עַ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃

H3117יָמִ֣יםyā-mîm   (N-mp)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		יָמִ֣יםyā-mîm the days N-mp

H3068יְהוָֽה׃Yah-weh.   (N-proper-ms)
H3068 יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh yeh-ho-vaw from הָיָה; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jehovah, Jewish national name of God; Jehovah, the Lord. Compare יָהּ, יְהֹוִה. 		יְהוָֽה׃Yah-weh. of Yahweh N-proper-ms
11 Look, the days come, says the Lord GOD, that I will send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the LORD:Amos 8:11
Stats
Rank: #829 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 166 characters, 29 words, 125 letters, 46 vowels, 79 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִ֗ים נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֔ה וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹֽא־רָעָ֤ב לַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ וְלֹֽא־צָמָ֣א לַמַּ֔יִם כִּ֣י אִם־לִשְׁמֹ֔עַ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃

Lit: Behold the days are coming says the Lord GOD that I will send a famine on the land Not a famine of bread nor a thirst for water for but of hearing the words of Yahweh

KJV: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord GOD, that I will send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the LORD:
References

"but"
1Sa 3:1: The child Samuel ministered to the LORD before Eli. And the word of the LORD was precious in those days; there was no open vision.
1Sa 28:6: 15: When Saul inquired of the LORD: the LORD answered Him not">not Him: neither by dreams: nor by Urim: nor by prophets.
Ps 74:9: We not see our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knows how long.
Isa 5:6: I will lay it waste: it will not be pruned: nor digged; but there will come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
Isa 30:20: 21: though the Lord give you the bread of adversity: and the water of affliction: yet will not your teachers be removed into a corner any more: but your eyes will see your teachers:
Eze 7:26: Mischief will come upon mischief: and rumour will be upon rumour; then will they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law will perish from the priest: and counsel from the ancients.
Mic 3:6: Therefore night will be to you: that you will not have a vision; and it will be dark to you: that you will not divine; and the sun will go down over the prophets: and the day will be dark over them.
Mt 9:36: But when he saw the multitudes: he was moved with compassion on them: because they fainted: and were scattered abroad: as sheep having no shepherd.

H4672 מָצָא mâtsâʼ maw-tsaw a primitive root; properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present; phrase be able, befall, being, catch, idiom certainly, (cause to) come (on, to, to hand), deliver, be enough (cause to) find(-ing, occasion, out), get (hold upon), idiom have (here), be here, hit, be left, light (up-) on, meet (with), idiom occasion serve, (be) present, ready, speed, suffice, take hold on. 		יִמְצָֽאוּ׃yim-ṣā-’ū. shall find it V-Qal-Imperf-3mp

14 They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say, Your god, O Dan, lives'>lives; and, The manner of Beersheba lives'>lives; even they will fall, and never rise up again.Amos 8:14
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: הַנִּשְׁבָּעִים֙ בְּאַשְׁמַ֣ת שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון וְאָמְר֗וּ חֵ֤י אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ דָּ֔ן וְחֵ֖י דֶּ֣רֶךְ בְּאֵֽר־שָׁ֑בַע וְנָפְל֖וּ וְלֹא־יָק֥וּמוּ עֹֽוד׃ ס

Lit: Those who swear by the sin of Samaria and who say as lives your god Dan and as lives the way of Beersheba and they shall fall and never rise again

KJV: They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say, Thy god, O Dan, liveth; and, The manner of Beersheba liveth; even they shall fall, and never rise up again.

"sin"

1Ki 13:22-34: But came back: and have eaten bread and drunk water in the place: of the which the LORD did say to you: Eat no bread: and drink no water; your carcase will not come to the sepulchre of your fathers.

Ho 13:2: 16: Now they sin more and more: and have made them molten images of their silver: and idols according to their own understanding: all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them: Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.

"manner"

"shall fall"

Ps 36:12: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down: and will not be able to rise.
Ps 140:10: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits: that they not rise up again.
Pr 29:1: He: that being often reproved hardens his neck: will suddenly be destroyed: and that without remedy.
Isa 43:17: Which brings forth the chariot and horse: the army and the power; they will lie down together: they will not rise: they are extinct: they are quenched as tow.
Jer 25:27: Therefore you will say to them: Thus says the LORD of hosts: the God of Israel; Drink you: and be drunken: and spue: and fall: and rise no more: because of the sword which I will send among you.
Jer 51:64: you will say: Thus will Babylon sink: and will not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they will be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.

9
The Destruction of Israel

רָאִ֨יתִי אֶת־אֲדֹנָ֜י נִצָּ֣ב עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיֹּאמֶר֩ הַ֨ךְ הַכַּפְתֹּ֜ור וְיִרְעֲשׁ֣וּ הַסִּפִּ֗ים וּבְצַ֙עַם֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ כֻּלָּ֔ם וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖ם בַּחֶ֣רֶב אֶהֱרֹ֑ג לֹֽא־יָנ֤וּס לָהֶם֙ נָ֔ס וְלֹֽא־יִמָּלֵ֥ט לָהֶ֖ם פָּלִֽיט׃

H7200רָאִ֨יתִיrā-’î-ṯî   (V-Qal-Perf-1cs)
H7200 רָאָה râʼâh raw-aw a primitive root; to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative); advise self, appear, approve, behold, idiom certainly, consider, discern, (make to) enjoy, have experience, gaze, take heed, idiom indeed, idiom joyfully, lo, look (on, one another, one on another, one upon another, out, up, upon), mark, meet, idiom be near, perceive, present, provide, regard, (have) respect, (fore-, cause to, let) see(-r, -m, one another), shew (self), idiom sight of others, (e-) spy, stare, idiom surely, idiom think, view, visions. 		רָאִ֨יתִיrā-’î-ṯî I saw V-Qal-Perf-1cs
H136אֲדֹנָ֜י’ă-ḏō-nāy   (N-proper-ms)
H136 אֲדֹנָי ʼĂdônây ad-o-noy an emphatic form of אָדוֹן; the Lord (used as a proper name of God only); (my) Lord. 		אֲדֹנָ֜י’ă-ḏō-nāy the Lord N-proper-ms
H5324נִצָּ֣בniṣ-ṣāḇ   (V-Nifal-Prtcpl-ms)
H5324 נָצַב nâtsab naw-tsab a primitive root; to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively); appointed, deputy, erect, establish, idiom Huzzah (by mistake for a proper name), lay, officer, pillar, present, rear up, set (over, up), settle, sharpen, establish, (make to) stand(-ing, still, up, upright), best state. 		נִצָּ֣בniṣ-ṣāḇ standing V-Nifal-Prtcpl-ms
H5921עַֽל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַֽל־‘al- by Prep

H559 אָמַר ʼâmar aw-mar a primitive root; to say (used with great latitude); answer, appoint, avouch, bid, boast self, call, certify, challenge, charge, phrase (at the, give) command(-ment), commune, consider, declare, demand, idiom desire, determine, idiom expressly, idiom indeed, idiom intend, name, idiom plainly, promise, publish, report, require, say, speak (against, of), idiom still, idiom suppose, talk, tell, term, idiom that is, idiom think, use (speech), utter, idiom verily, idiom yet. 		וַיֹּאמֶר֩way-yō-mer and He said Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms
H5221הַ֨ךְhaḵ   (V-Hifil-Imp-ms)
H5221 נָכָה nâkâh naw-kaw a primitive root; to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively); beat, cast forth, clap, give (wounds), idiom go forward, idiom indeed, kill, make (slaughter), murderer, punish, slaughter, slay(-er, -ing), smite(-r, -ing), strike, be stricken, (give) stripes, idiom surely, wound. 		הַ֨ךְhaḵ Strike V-Hifil-Imp-ms
H3730הַכַּפְתּ֜וֹרhak-kap̄-tō-wr   (Art | N-ms)
H3730 כַּפְתֹּר kaphtôr kaf-tore or (Amos 9:1) כַּפְתּוֹר; probably from an unused root meaning to encircle; a chaplet; but used only in an architectonic sense, i.e. the capital of acolumn, or a wreath-like button or disk on the candelabrum; knop, (upper) lintel. 		הַכַּפְתּ֜וֹרhak-kap̄-tō-wr the doorposts Art | N-ms
H7493וְיִרְעֲשׁ֣וּwə-yir-‘ă-šū   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjImperf-3mp)
H7493 רָעַשׁ râʻash raw-ash a primitive root; to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust); make afraid, (re-) move, quake, (make to) shake, (make to) tremble. 		וְיִרְעֲשׁ֣וּwə-yir-‘ă-šū that may shake Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjImperf-3mp
H5592הַסִּפִּ֗יםhas-sip-pîm,   (Art | N-mp)
H5592 סַף çaph saf from סָפַף, in its original sense of containing; a vestibule (as a limit); also a dish (for holding blood or wine); bason, bowl, cup, door (post), gate, post, threshold. 		הַסִּפִּ֗יםhas-sip-pîm, the thresholds Art | N-mp
H1214וּבְצַ֙עַם֙ū-ḇə-ṣa-‘am   (Conj-w | V-Qal-Imp-ms | 3mp)
H1214 בָּצַע bâtsaʻ baw-tsah a primitive root to break off, i.e. (usually) plunder; figuratively, to finish, or (intransitively) stop; (be) covet(-ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded. 		וּבְצַ֙עַם֙ū-ḇə-ṣa-‘am and break them Conj-w | V-Qal-Imp-ms | 3mp
H7218בְּרֹ֣אשׁbə-rōš   (Prep-b | N-msc)
H7218 רֹאשׁ rôʼsh roshe from an unused root apparently meaning to shake; the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.); band, beginning, captain, chapiter, chief(-est place, man, things), company, end, idiom every (man), excellent, first, forefront, (be-)head, height, (on) high(-est part, (priest)), idiom lead, idiom poor, principal, ruler, sum, top. 		בְּרֹ֣אשׁbə-rōš on the heads Prep-b | N-msc
H3605כֻּלָּ֔םkul-lām,   (N-msc | 3mp)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כֻּלָּ֔םkul-lām, of them all N-msc | 3mp

H319 אַחֲרִית ʼachărîyth akh-ar-eeth from אַחַר; the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity; (last, latter) end (time), hinder (utter) -most, length, posterity, remnant, residue, reward. 		וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖םwə-’a-ḥă-rî-ṯām and the last of them Conj-w | N-fsc | 3mp
H2719בַּחֶ֣רֶבba-ḥe-reḇ   (Prep-b, Art | N-fs)
H2719 חֶרֶב chereb kheh-reb from חָרַב; drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement; axe, dagger, knife, mattock, sword, tool. 		בַּחֶ֣רֶבba-ḥe-reḇ with the sword Prep-b, Art | N-fs

H2026 הָרַג hârag haw-rag a primitive root; to smite with deadly intent; destroy, out of hand, kill, murder(-er), put to (death), make (slaughter), slay(-er), idiom surely. 		אֶהֱרֹ֑ג’e-hĕ-rōḡ; I will slay V-Qal-Imperf-1cs
H3808לֹֽא־lō-   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹֽא־lō- not Adv-NegPrt
H5127יָנ֤וּסyā-nūs   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)
H5127 נוּס nûwç noos a primitive root; to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver); idiom abate, away, be displayed, (make to) flee (away, -ing), put to flight, idiom hide, lift up a standard. 		יָנ֤וּסyā-nūs He who flees V-Qal-Imperf-3ms

H4422 מָלַט mâlaṭ maw-lat a primitive root; properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks; deliver (self), escape, lay, leap out, let alone, let go, preserve, save, idiom speedily, idiom surely. 		יִמָּלֵ֥טyim-mā-lêṭ shall be delivered V-Nifal-Imperf-3ms

H6412פָּלִֽיט׃pā-lîṭ.   (N-ms)
H6412 פָּלִיט pâlîyṭ paw-leet or פָּלֵיט; or פָּלֵט; from פָּלַט; a refugee; (that have) escape(-d, -th), fugitive. 		פָּלִֽיט׃pā-lîṭ. he who escapes N-ms
1 I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and He said, Smite the lintel of the door, that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head, all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: He that'>He who flees of them will not flee away, and He that'>He who escapes of them will not be delivered.Amos 9:1
Stats
Counts: 293 characters, 53 words, 224 letters, 78 vowels, 146 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: רָאִ֨יתִי אֶת־אֲדֹנָ֜י נִצָּ֣ב עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיֹּאמֶר֩ הַ֨ךְ הַכַּפְתֹּ֜ור וְיִרְעֲשׁ֣וּ הַסִּפִּ֗ים וּבְצַ֙עַם֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ כֻּלָּ֔ם וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖ם בַּחֶ֣רֶב אֶהֱרֹ֑ג לֹֽא־יָנ֤וּס לָהֶם֙ נָ֔ס וְלֹֽא־יִמָּלֵ֥ט לָהֶ֖ם פָּלִֽיט׃

Lit: I saw the Lord standing by the altar and He said Strike the doorposts that may shake the thresholds and break them on the heads of them all and the last of them with the sword I will slay not He who flees from them shall get away and not shall be delivered from them he who escapes

KJV: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and he said, Smite the lintel of the door, that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head, all of them; and I will slay the last of them with the sword: he that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth of them shall not be delivered.
References

"I saw"
2Ch 18:18: Again He said: Therefore hear the word of the LORD; I saw the LORD sitting upon His throne: and all the host of heaven standing on His right hand and on His left.
Isa 6:1: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne: high and lifted up: and His train filled the temple.
Eze 1:28: As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain: so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the LORD. And when I saw it: I fell upon my face: and I heard a voice of one that spoke.
Joh 1:18: 32: No man has seen God at any time; the only begotten Son: which is in the bosom of the Father: He has declared Him.
Ac 26:13: At midday: O king: I saw in the way a light from heaven: above the brightness of the sun: shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.
Re 1:17: When I saw him: I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me: saying to me: not Fear; I am the first and the last:

"upon"
Am 3:14: That in the day that I will visit the transgressions of Israel upon him I will also visit the altars of Bethel: and the horns of the altar will be cut off: and fall to the ground.
Eze 9:2: And: look: 6 men came from the way of the higher gate: which lies toward the north: and every man a slaughter weapon in his hand; and one man among them was clothed with linen: with a writer's inkhorn by his side: and they went in: and stood beside the brasen altar.
Eze 10:4: Then the glory of the LORD went up from the cherub: and stood over the threshold of the house; and the house was filled with the cloud: and the court was full of the brightness of the LORD's glory.

"Smite"
Isa 6:3: 4: One cried to another: and said: Holy: holy: holy: is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of His glory.
Zec 11:1: 2: Open your doors: O Lebanon: that the fire may devour your cedars.

"in the head"
Ps 68:21: But God will wound the head of His enemies: and the hairy scalp of such an one as goes on still in His trespasses.
Hab 3:13: You went forth for the salvation of your people: even for salvation with your anointed; you woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked: by discovering the foundation to the neck. Selah.

"shall not flee"
Am 2:14: 15: Therefore the flight will perish from the swift: and the strong will not strengthen his force: neither will the mighty deliver himself:
Isa 24:17: 18: Fear: and the pit: and the snare: are upon you: O inhabitant of the earth.
Isa 30:16: But you said: No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore will you flee: and: We will ride upon the swift; therefore will they that pursue you be swift.
Jer 48:44: He who flees from the fear will fall into the pit; and He that'>He who gets up out of the pit will be taken in the snare: for I will bring upon it: even upon Moab: the year of their visitation: says the LORD.

 אִם־יַחְתְּר֣וּ בִשְׁאֹ֔ול מִשָּׁ֖ם יָדִ֣י תִקָּחֵ֑ם וְאִֽם־יַעֲלוּ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם מִשָּׁ֖ם אֹורִידֵֽם׃

H518אִם־’im-   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- Though Conj

H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		יָדִ֣יyā-ḏî my hand N-fsc | 1cs

H5927 עָלָה ʻâlâh aw-law a primitive root; to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative; arise (up), (cause to) ascend up, at once, break (the day) (up), bring (up), (cause to) burn, carry up, cast up, phrase shew, climb (up), (cause to, make to) come (up), cut off, dawn, depart, exalt, excel, fall, fetch up, get up, (make to) go (away, up); grow (over) increase, lay, leap, levy, lift (self) up, light, (make) up, idiom mention, mount up, offer, make to pay, phrase perfect, prefer, put (on), raise, recover, restore, (make to) rise (up), scale, set (up), shoot forth (up), (begin to) spring (up), stir up, take away (up), work. 		יַעֲלוּ֙ya-‘ă-lū they climb up V-Qal-Imperf-3mp
H8064הַשָּׁמַ֔יִםhaš-šā-ma-yim,   (Art | N-mp)
H8064 שָׁמַיִם shâmayim shaw-mah-yim dual of an unused singular שָׁמֶה; from an unused root meaning to be lofty; the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve); air, idiom astrologer, heaven(-s). 		הַשָּׁמַ֔יִםhaš-šā-ma-yim, to heaven Art | N-mp

H3381אוֹרִידֵֽם׃’ō-w-rî-ḏêm.   (V-Hifil-Imperf-1cs | 3mp)
H3381 יָרַד yârad yaw-rad a primitive root; to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications); idiom abundantly, bring down, carry down, cast down, (cause to) come(-ing) down, fall (down), get down, go(-ing) down(-ward), hang down, idiom indeed, let down, light (down), put down (off), (cause to, let) run down, sink, subdue, take down. 		אוֹרִידֵֽם׃’ō-w-rî-ḏêm. I will bring them down V-Hifil-Imperf-1cs | 3mp
2 Though they dig into hell, there will my hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, there will I bring them down:Amos 9:2
Stats
Rank: #9464 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 123 characters, 20 words, 97 letters, 32 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־יַחְתְּר֣וּ בִשְׁאֹ֔ול מִשָּׁ֖ם יָדִ֣י תִקָּחֵ֑ם וְאִֽם־יַעֲלוּ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם מִשָּׁ֖ם אֹורִידֵֽם׃

Lit: Though they dig into hell from there my hand shall take them and Though they climb up to heaven from there I will bring them down

KJV: Though they dig into hell, thence shall mine hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down:
References

"dig"
Job 26:6: Hell is naked before him: and destruction has no covering.
Ps 139:7-10: Whither will I go from your spirit? or whither will I flee from your presence?
Isa 2:19: They will go into the holes of the rocks: and into the caves of the earth: for fear of the LORD: and for the glory of His majesty: when He arises to shake terribly the earth.

"climb"
Job 20:6: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens: and his head reach to the clouds;
Isa 14:13-16: For you have said in your heart: I will ascend into heaven: I will exalt my throne above the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation: in the sides of the north:
Jer 49:16: Your terribleness has deceived you: and the pride of your heart: O you that dwell in the clefts of the rock: that hold the height of the hill: though you should make your nest as high as the eagle: I will bring you down from there: says the LORD.
Jer 51:53: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven: and though she should fortify the height of her strength: yet from me will spoilers come to her: says the LORD.
Eze 28:13-16: You have been in Eden the garden of God; every precious stone was your covering: the sardius: topaz: and the diamond: the beryl: the onyx: and the jasper: the sapphire: the emerald: and the carbuncle: and gold: the workmanship of your tabrets and of your pipes was prepared in you in the day that you were created.
Ob 1:4: Though you exalt yourself as the eagle: and though you set your nest among the stars: there will I bring you down: says the LORD.
Lu 10:18: He said to them: I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.

 וְאִם־יֵחָֽבְאוּ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶ֔ל מִשָּׁ֥ם אֲחַפֵּ֖שׂ וּלְקַחְתִּ֑ים וְאִם־יִסָּ֨תְר֜וּ מִנֶּ֤גֶד עֵינַי֙ בְּקַרְקַ֣ע הַיָּ֔ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַנָּחָ֖שׁ וּנְשָׁכָֽם׃

3 Though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out there; and though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea, there will I command the serpent, and he will bite them:Amos 9:3
Stats
Counts: 215 characters, 39 words, 168 letters, 58 vowels, 110 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאִם־יֵחָֽבְאוּ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶ֔ל מִשָּׁ֥ם אֲחַפֵּ֖שׂ וּלְקַחְתִּ֑ים וְאִם־יִסָּ֨תְר֜וּ מִנֶּ֤גֶד עֵינַי֙ בְּקַרְקַ֣ע הַיָּ֔ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַנָּחָ֖שׁ וּנְשָׁכָֽם׃

Lit: and though they hide themselves on top of Carmel from there I will search and take them and Though they hide from My sight at the bottom of the sea from there I will command the serpent and it shall bite them

KJV: And though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea, thence will I command the serpent, and he shall bite them:
References

"hide"
Job 34:22: There is no darkness: nor shadow of death: where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
Jer 23:23: 24: Am I a God at hand: says the LORD: not and a God afar off?

"hid"
Ps 139:9-11: If I take the wings of the morning: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
Jer 16:16: Look: I will send for many fishers: says the LORD: and they will fish them; and after will I send for many hunters: and they will hunt them from every mountain: and from every hill: and out of the holes of the rocks.

"the serpent"
Isa 27:1: In that day the LORD with His sore and great and strong sword will punish leviathan the piercing serpent: even leviathan that crooked serpent; and He will kill the dragon that is in the sea.

4 Though they go into captivity before their enemies, there will I command the sword, and it will kill them: and I will set my eyes upon them for evil, not and for good.Amos 9:4
Stats
Counts: 175 characters, 30 words, 137 letters, 51 vowels, 86 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאִם־יֵלְכ֤וּ בַשְּׁבִי֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹֽיבֵיהֶ֔ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב וַהֲרָגָ֑תַם וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י עֵינִ֧י עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם לְרָעָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א לְטֹובָֽה׃

Lit: And Though they go into captivity before their enemies from there I will command the sword and it shall slay them and I will set My eyes on them for harm and not for good

KJV: And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I command the sword, and it shall slay them: and I will set mine eyes upon them for evil, and not for good.
References

"go"

Zec 13:8: 9: It will come to pass: that in all the land: says the LORD: two parts therein will be cut off and die; but the third will be left therein.

"set"

5 The Lord GOD of hosts is He that'>He who touches the land, and it will melt, and all that dwell therein will mourn: and it will rise up wholly like a flood; and will be drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.Amos 9:5
Stats
Counts: 206 characters, 35 words, 157 letters, 51 vowels, 106 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַאדֹנָ֨י יְהוִ֜ה הַצְּבָאֹ֗ות הַנֹּוגֵ֤עַ בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ וַתָּמֹ֔וג וְאָבְל֖וּ כָּל־יֹ֣ושְׁבֵי בָ֑הּ וְעָלְתָ֤ה כַיְאֹר֙ כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְשָׁקְעָ֖ה כִּיאֹ֥ר מִצְרָֽיִם׃

Lit: And the Lord GOD of hosts He who touches the earth and it melts and mourn all who dwell there and shall swell like the Nile all of it and subside like the Nile of Egypt

KJV: And the Lord GOD of hosts is he that toucheth the land, and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise up wholly like a flood; and shall be drowned, as [by] the flood of Egypt.
References

"toucheth"
Ps 46:6: The heathen raged: the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice: the earth melted.
Ps 144:5: Bow your heavens: O LORD: and come down: touch the mountains: and they will smoke.
Isa 64:1: Oh that you would'>would rend the heavens: that you would'>would come down: that the mountains might flow down at your presence:
Mic 1:3: For: look: the LORD comes forth out of His place: and will come down: and tread upon the high places of the earth.
Na 1:6: Who can stand before his indignation? and who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? his fury is poured out like fire: and the rocks are thrown down by him.
Hab 3:10: The mountains saw you: and they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice: and lifted up his hands on high.
Re 20:11: I saw a great white throne: and him that sat on it: from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

"and all"
Am 8:8: Will not the land tremble for this: and every one mourn that dwells therein? and it will rise up wholly as a flood; and it will be cast out and drowned: as by the flood of Egypt.
Jer 12:4: How long will the land mourn: and the herbs of every field where: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed: and the birds; because they said: He will not see our last end.
Ho 4:3: Therefore will the land mourn: and every one that dwells therein will languish: with the beasts of the field: and with the fowls of heaven; yes: the fishes of the sea also will be taken away.

"shall rise"
Ps 32:6: For this will every one that is godly pray to you in a time when you may be found: surely in the floods of great waters they will not come nigh to him.
Ps 93:3: 4: The floods have lifted up: O LORD: the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.
Isa 8:7: 8: Now therefore: look: the Lord brings up upon them the waters of the river: strong and many: even the king of Assyria: and all His glory: and He will come up over all His channels: and go over all His banks:
Mt 7:27: The rain descended: and the floods came: and the winds blew: and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.

6 It is He that'>He who builds His stories in the heaven, and has founded His troop in the earth; He that'>He who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is His name.Amos 9:6
Stats
Counts: 206 characters, 36 words, 158 letters, 62 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַבֹּונֶ֤ה בַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ [מַעֲלֹותֹו כ] (מַעֲלֹותָ֔יו ק) וַאֲגֻדָּתֹ֖ו עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ יְסָדָ֑הּ הַקֹּרֵ֣א לְמֵֽי־הַיָּ֗ם וַֽיִּשְׁפְּכֵ֛ם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ יְהוָ֥ה שְׁמֹֽו׃

Lit: He who builds in the sky His layers and His strata in the earth has founded who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out on the face of the earth Yahweh is His name

KJV: It is he that buildeth his stories in the heaven, and hath founded his troop in the earth; he that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD [is] his name.
References

"buildeth"
Ps 104:3: 13: Who lays the beams of his chambers in the waters: who makes the clouds his chariot: who walks upon the wings of the wind:

"troop"
Ge 2:1: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished: and all the host of them.

"calleth"
Am 5:8: Seek Him that makes'>makes the 7 stars and Orion: and turns the shadow of death into the morning: and makes'>makes the day dark with night: that calls for the waters of the sea: and pours them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is His name:
Ge 7:11-19: In the 6 hundredth year of Noah's life: in the second month: the seventeenth day of the month: the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up: and the windows of heaven were opened.
Jer 5:22: Fear you not me? says the LORD: will you not tremble at my presence: which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree: that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves: yet can not they prevail; though they roar: yet can not they pass over it?

"The Lord"
Am 4:13: For: indeed: He that'>He who forms the mountains: and creates the wind: and declares to man what is His thought: that makes the morning darkness: and treads upon the high places of the earth: The LORD: The God of hosts: is His name.
Ex 3:14: 15: God said to Moses: I AM THAT I AM: and He said: Thus will you say to the children of Israel: I AM has sent me to you.

H3808הֲל֣וֹאhă-lō-w   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		הֲל֣וֹאhă-lō-w Are not Adv-NegPrt

H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		כִבְנֵי֩ḵiḇ-nê like the sons Prep-k | N-mpc

7 Are you not as children of the Ethiopians to me, O children of Israel? says the LORD. not Have I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?Amos 9:7
Stats
Rank: #7623 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 202 characters, 34 words, 158 letters, 60 vowels, 98 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣וא כִבְנֵי֩ כֻשִׁיִּ֨ים אַתֶּ֥ם לִ֛י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהוָ֑ה הֲלֹ֣וא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הֶעֱלֵ֙יתִי֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּפְלִשְׁתִּיִּ֥ים מִכַּפְתֹּ֖ור וַאֲרָ֥ם מִקִּֽיר׃

Lit: Are not like the sons of the Ethiopians you to Me sons of Israel says Yahweh Did not Israel I bring up from the land of Egypt and the Philistines from Caphtor and the Syria from Kir

KJV: Are ye not as children of the Ethiopians unto me, O children of Israel? saith the LORD. Have not I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?
References

"ye not"
Jer 9:25: 26: Look: the days come: says the LORD: that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;
Jer 13:23: Can the Ethiopian change his skin: or the leopard his spots? then may you also do good: that are accustomed to do evil.

"Have not"
Am 2:10: Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt: and led you 40 years through the wilderness: to possess the land of the Amorite.
Ex 12:51: It came to pass the selfsame day: that the LORD did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.
Ho 12:13: By a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt: and by a prophet was He preserved.

"the Philistines"
De 2:23: The Avims which dwelt in Hazerim: even to Azzah: the Caphtorims: which came forth out of Caphtor: destroyed them: and dwelt in their stead.)
Jer 47:4: Because of the day that comes to spoil all the Philistines: and to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remains: for the LORD will spoil the Philistines: the remnant of the country of Caphtor.

"the Syrians"
Am 1:5: I will break also the bar of Damascus: and cut off the inhabitant from the plain of Aven: and Him that holds the sceptre from the house of Eden: and the people of Syria will go into captivity to Kir: says the LORD.
2Ki 16:9: The king of Assyria listened to him: for the king of Assyria went up against Damascus: and took it: and carried the people of it captive to Kir: and killed Rezin.

 הִנֵּ֞ה עֵינֵ֣י ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֗ה בַּמַּמְלָכָה֙ הַֽחַטָּאָ֔ה וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה אֶ֗פֶס כִּ֠י לֹ֣א הַשְׁמֵ֥יד אַשְׁמִ֛יד אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יַעֲקֹ֖ב נְאֻם־יְהוָֽה׃

8 Look, the eyes of the Lord GOD are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth; saving that I not will utterly destroy the house of Jacob, says the LORD.Amos 9:8
Stats
Counts: 190 characters, 34 words, 148 letters, 54 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִנֵּ֞ה עֵינֵ֣י ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֗ה בַּמַּמְלָכָה֙ הַֽחַטָּאָ֔ה וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה אֶ֗פֶס כִּ֠י לֹ֣א הַשְׁמֵ֥יד אַשְׁמִ֛יד אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יַעֲקֹ֖ב נְאֻם־יְהוָֽה׃

Lit: Behold the eyes of the Lord GOD are on kingdom the sinful and I will destroy it from the face of the earth saving yet not utterly I will destroy the house of Jacob says Yahweh

KJV: Behold, the eyes of the Lord GOD are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth; saving that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith the LORD.
References

"the eyes"
Am 9:4: Though they go into captivity before their enemies: there will I command the sword: and it will kill them: and I will set my eyes upon them for evil: not and for good.
Ps 11:4-6: The LORD is in His holy temple: the LORD's throne is in heaven: His eyes look: His eyelids try: the children of men.
Pr 5:21: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD: and He ponders all His goings.
Pr 15:3: The eyes of the LORD are in every place: beholding the evil and the good.
Jer 44:27: Look: I will watch over them for evil: not and for good: and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt will be consumed by the sword and by the famine: until there be an end of them.

"and I"
Ge 6:7: The LORD said: I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man: and beast: and the creeping thing: and the fowls of the air; for it repents me that I have made them.
Ge 7:4: For yet 7 days: and I will cause it to rain upon the earth 40 days and 40 nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.
De 6:15: (For the LORD your God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the LORD your God be kindled against you: and destroy you from off the face of the earth.
1Ki 13:34: This thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam: even to cut it off: and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
Ho 1:6: She conceived again: and bare a daughter. And God said to Him: Call her name Loruhamah: for I will no more have mercy upon the house of Israel; but I will utterly take them away.
Ho 9:11-17: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.
Ho 13:15: 16: Though He be fruitful among His brothers: an east wind will come: the wind of the LORD will come up from the wilderness: and His spring will become dry: and His fountain will be dried up: He will spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.

"savings"
De 4:31: (For the LORD your God is a merciful God;) He not will forsake you: neither destroy you: nor forget the covenant of your fathers which He sware to them.
Isa 27:7: 8: Has he smitten him: as he smote those that smote him? or is he killed according to the slaughter of them that are killed by him?
Jer 5:10: Go you up upon her walls: and destroy; but not make a full end: take away her battlements; for they are not the LORD's.
Jer 30:11: For I am with you: says the LORD: to save you: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered you: yet will not I make a full end of you: but I will correct you in measure: and not will leave you altogether unpunished.
Jer 31:35: 36: Thus says the LORD: which gives the sun for a light by day: and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night: which divides the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is His name:
Jer 33:24-26: Consider you not what this people have spoken: saying: The two families which the LORD has chosen: He has even cast them off? thus they have despised my people: that they should be no more a nation before them.
Joe 2:32: It will come to pass: that whoever will call on the name of the LORD will be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem will be deliverance: as the LORD has said: and in the remnant whom the LORD will call.
Ob 1:16: 17: For as you have drunk upon my holy mountain: so will all the heathen drink continually: yes: they will drink: and they will swallow down: and they will be as though they not had been.
Ro 11:1-7: 28: 29: I say then: Has God cast away His people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite: of the seed of Abraham: of the tribe of Benjamin.

 כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֔ה וַהֲנִעֹ֥ותִי בְכָֽל־הַגֹּויִ֖ם אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנֹּ֙ועַ֙ בַּכְּבָרָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יִפֹּ֥ול צְרֹ֖ור אָֽרֶץ׃

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj

9 For, indeed, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations, like as grain is sifted in a sieve, yet will not the least grain fall upon the earth.Amos 9:9
Stats
Counts: 165 characters, 29 words, 126 letters, 50 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֔ה וַהֲנִעֹ֥ותִי בְכָֽל־הַגֹּויִ֖ם אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנֹּ֙ועַ֙ בַּכְּבָרָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יִפֹּ֥ול צְרֹ֖ור אָֽרֶץ׃

Lit: For surely I will command and will sift among all nations the house of Israel as grain is sifted in a sieve and yet not shall fall the smallest grain to the ground

KJV: For, lo, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations, like as corn is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not the least grain fall upon the earth.
References

"and I"
Le 26:33: I will scatter you among the heathen: and will draw out a sword after you: and your land will be desolate: and your cities waste.
De 28:64: The LORD will scatter you among all people: from the one end of the earth even to the other; and there you will serve other gods: which neither you nor your fathers have known: even wood and stone.

(Incl. feminine raaah; as adjective or noun.)., 		הָרָעָֽה׃hā-rā-‘āh. the calamity Art | Adj-fs
10 All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, which say, The evil will not overtake nor prevent us.Amos 9:10
Stats
Rank: #2629 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 107 characters, 19 words, 84 letters, 28 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּחֶ֣רֶב יָמ֔וּתוּ כֹּ֖ל חַטָּאֵ֣י עַמִּ֑י הָאֹמְרִ֗ים לֹֽא־תַגִּ֧ישׁ וְתַקְדִּ֛ים בַּעֲדֵ֖ינוּ הָרָעָֽה׃

Lit: By the sword shall die all the sinful of My people who say not shall overtake nor confront us the calamity

KJV: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.
References

"the sinners"
Isa 33:14: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness has surprised the hypocrites. Who among us will dwell with the devouring fire? who among us will dwell with everlasting burnings?
Eze 20:38: I will purge out from among you the rebels: and them that transgress against me: I will bring them forth out of the country where they sojourn: and they will not enter into the land of Israel: and you will know that I am the LORD.
Eze 34:16: 17: I will seek that which was lost: and bring again that which was driven away: and will bind up that which was broken: and will strengthen that which was sick: but I will destroy the fat and the strong; I will feed them with judgment.
Zep 3:11-13: In that day will you not be ashamed for all your doings: wherein you have transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the middle of you them that rejoice in your pride: and you will no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
Zec 13:8: 9: It will come to pass: that in all the land: says the LORD: two parts therein will be cut off and die; but the third will be left therein.
Mal 3:2-5: But who may abide the day of his coming? and who will stand when he appears? for he is like a refiner's fire: and like fullers' soap:

Mt 3:10-12: Now also the axe is laid to the root of the trees: therefore every tree which brings not forth good fruit is cut down: and cast into the fire.
Mt 13:41: 42: 49: 50: The Son of man will send forth His angels: and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend: and them which do iniquity;

Ec 8:11: Because sentence against an evil work not is executed speedily: therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.

Mal 3:15: Now we call the proud happy; yes: they that work wickedness are set up; yes: they that tempt God are even delivered.

A Promise of Restoration

בַּיֹּ֣ום הַה֔וּא אָקִ֛ים אֶת־סֻכַּ֥ת דָּוִ֖יד הַנֹּפֶ֑לֶת וְגָדַרְתִּ֣י אֶת־פִּרְצֵיהֶ֗ן וַהֲרִֽסֹתָיו֙ אָקִ֔ים וּבְנִיתִ֖יהָ כִּימֵ֥י עֹולָֽם׃

H3117בַּיּ֣וֹםbay-yō-wm   (Prep-b, Art | N-ms)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		בַּיּ֣וֹםbay-yō-wm On day Prep-b, Art | N-ms
